commit_message:
Add sysinfo_serial to control Serial number gen

Add sysinfo_serial parameter to control a Serial number entry
generation method. Defaults to $::os_service_default.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia66831c85b046b37c950662839d73142510b4a89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/10/839310/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*sysinfo_serial*] # (optional) Option to specify a serial number entry generation method. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $sysinfo_serial = $::os_service_default, 'libvirt/sysinfo_serial': value => $sysinfo_serial;

Drop install_venv

install_venv is a legacy and not used in our CI,so drop it completely.

Change-Id: I958a2956f1bba446aa2de1428c286e75060b7117

""" print(help % (venv, root)) def main(argv): root = os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__))) if os.environ.get('TOOLS_PATH'): root = os.environ['TOOLS_PATH'] venv = os.path.join(root, '.venv') if os.environ.get('VENV'): venv = os.environ['VENV'] pip_requires = os.path.join(root, 'requirements.txt') test_requires = os.path.join(root, 'test-requirements.txt') py_version = "python%s.%s" % (sys.version_info[0], sys.version_info[1]) project = 'OpenStack' install = install_venv.InstallVenv(root, venv, pip_requires, test_requires, py_version, project) options = install.parse_args(argv) install.check_dependencies() install.create_virtualenv(no_site_packages=options.no_site_packages) install.install_dependencies() print_help(venv, root) if __name__ == '__main__': main(sys.argv)

commit_message:
Preserve local mirrors when using Ubuntu element

Cloud-init overwrites sources.list on boot. This causes issues when using
locally-defined or other repositories in a custom sources.list file.
This change adding a script and a DIB arg to the Ubuntu element adds
the configuration necessary to prevent this behaviour.

Change-Id: I29d0afbe612f827dfbc7c5266e2873918a09cf6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/47/841247/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash if [[ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 1 ]]; then set -x fi set -eu set -o pipefail if [[ -n "${DIB_PREVENT_SOURCES_OVERWRITE:-}" ]]; then # Prevent cloud-init from overwriting custom sources list echo 'creating /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/92-apt-preserve-source-list.cfg' sudo sh -c 'echo "apt_preserve_sources_list: true" > /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/92-apt-preserve-source-list.cfg' fi

commit_message:
Fix Ocata series state

Ocata went to End of Life several months ago [1], but it took time to
transition all the projects and it was forgotten to mark Ocata series
status as EOL. This patch corrects now Ocata status.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/022989.html

Change-Id: I7a5f71c731d9ad6e423e70c03210814d273a9974
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/69/838569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pass valid cert regen variable to pki role

Currently we're passing non-existant variable into PKI role
when defining whether to regen certificates or not.
This change fixes behaviour.

Change-Id: Ib1c8f820ccfe00923fcbc7aec2457a94629673fe

commit_message:
Mark requirements' ocata branch as EOL

Since every project transitioned to End of Life already, requirements
should have tagged with EOL, too. This patch tags latest patch on
stable/ocata with ocata-eol and the branch can be deleted afterwards.

Change-Id: I197457d2160a1668013854bd390779dc3c2c9002

commit_message:
Refactor admin password related actions code for better maintenance

Moved rotate-admin-password action to admin-password.py and made
changes to the unit test accordingly. Putting admin password
related actions together will reduce confusion and improve
maintainability

Change-Id: I27f8d3a279833dde5f6021e9d78a5ab2f05445b2

added_lines: function create_an_image_from_volume { local image_name=$1 local volume_name=$2 local attempt openstack image create --volume $volume_name $image_name attempt=1 while [[ $(openstack image show $image_name -f value -c status) != "active" ]]; do echo "Image $image_name not active yet" attempt=$((attempt+1)) if [[ $attempt -eq 10 ]]; then echo "Image $image_name failed to become active" openstack image show $image_name return 1 fi sleep 10 done } echo "TESTING: Glance image from Cinder volume and back to volume" create_a_volume test_volume_to_image openstack volume show test_volume_to_image create_an_image_from_volume test_image_from_volume test_volume_to_image create_a_volume_from_image test_volume_from_image_from_volume test_volume_to_image openstack volume show test_volume_from_image_from_volume attach_and_detach_a_volume test_volume_from_image_from_volume kolla_boot_test delete_a_volume test_volume_from_image_from_volume openstack image delete test_image_from_volume delete_a_volume test_volume_to_image echo "SUCCESS: Glance image from Cinder volume and back to volume"

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2022-05-09 16:35:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/bcbe2f1e4536ec9c8d26bd550b6d642005df2af1', 'message': 'Normalize the server_addr dashboard backend

The server_addr dashboard backend should be the same argument used as
instance of the current ceph-mgr container running on a controller node.
Due to a recent change in pacific the container name and the ceph-mgr

rework the way this info is retrieved from ceph.

Change-Id: Ifc9a0a9ac2f13c891ccde826aef2ab7cbdb5d690
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2022-05-09 21:22:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/99b10a0dfc6126d4f3320d40b1d28a18ef91b7ef', 'message': 'Normalize the server_addr dashboard backend

The server_addr dashboard backend should be the same argument used as
instance of the current ceph-mgr container running on a controller node.
Due to a recent change in pacific the container name and the ceph-mgr
instance are not consistent anymore, and the purpose of this patch is to
rework the way this info is retrieved from ceph.

commit_message:
Normalize the server_addr dashboard backend

The server_addr dashboard backend should be the same argument used as
instance of the current ceph-mgr container running on a controller node.
Due to a recent change in pacific the container name and the ceph-mgr
instance are not consistent anymore, and the purpose of this patch is to
rework the way this info is retrieved from ceph.

Closes-Bug: #1972729
Change-Id: Ifc9a0a9ac2f13c891ccde826aef2ab7cbdb5d690

commit_message:
Remove sanity checks

"Smoke tests" for barbican, cinder, glance and keystone have been removed as discussed in PTG April 2022.

Signed-off-by: Tim Beermann <beermann@osism.tech>
Change-Id: I613287a31e0ea6aede070e7e9c519ab2f5f182bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/16/839716/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | In the April 2022 PTG the deprecation and removal of the sanity checks has been confirmed. Therefore the usage of .. code-block:: bash kolla-ansible check is not possible any more. features: - | Sanity checks have been removed. These "smoke tests" orignially were implemented for barbican, cinder, glance and keystone.

commit_message:
baremetal: refactor docker deployment into a separate role

The multitude of set_fact tasks have been replaced with task variables.

The deprecated docker_custom_option variable has been removed.

Change-Id: If3468ab06a64b5998314da1de2644cef3999ece6

commit_message:
ovn: add ovn-openflow-probe-interval var

The inactivity probe interval of the OpenFlow  connection
to the OpenvSwitch integration bridge, in seconds. If the
value is zero, it disables the connection keepalive  fea
ture.

If  the  value  is  nonzero,  then it will be forced to a
value of at least 5s.

The value is set to 60 seconds by default as described in
"OVN issues in the field".

https://www.openvswitch.org/support/ovscon2019/day1/1436-OVSCON-Nouman.pdf
https://www.ovn.org/support/dist-docs/ovn-controller.8.html

Change-Id: I7066c3a8b33b482774f310c45142ac2936a5c405

added_lines: - { name: ovn-openflow-probe-interval, value: "{{ ovn_openflow_probe_interval }}" }

commit_message:
Add doc fix for all-in-one in venv

When running in virtual environment a bootstrapping task will
install 'docker' python module in the environment. After that
prechecks and deploy phase will not find the module because
their 'ansible interpreter' is host wide. With this fix it is
advised to set an interpreter to the one in virtual environment

Closes-Bug: #1969812
Change-Id: I1bb6a3af3fa6346fff0a262e0c53d12c544f46db
(cherry picked from commit 5bcf5391bc81c2eadfc24a619691316c02554f73)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/16/839916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For ``all-in-one`` scenario in virtual environment add the following to the very beginning of the inventory: .. code-block:: console localhost ansible_python_interpreter=python

commit_message:
[CI] Raise [keystone_authtoken]http_request_max_retries

This is in the hope to avoid random "Unable to validate token" in
AIO upgrade jobs which restart the Keystone container while
other services are trying to use it (most notably Placement but
also Nova and Neutron).

Change-Id: Ie6a95c3ca84df82ca8463cf76054e125cb1ffff1
(cherry picked from commit 7ccea278279fa70a98c227a3a8c994feb94b40b4)

subject: Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-11 11:52:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder/commit/b44fc33093d7e5656c5abbeb328580a783ea1eb0', 'message': "Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-05-12 11:01:47.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder/commit/a50281db835fc139912f09fedb6e00dba9f333a5', 'message': "Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383
"}]
commit_message:
Stop endless cycles on openstack upgrade

If an HA cinder deployment is upgraded twice and the leadership has
changed, there is a potential race that can be triggered where because
the CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY is different on the units that have been the
leader.  This race is that when the unit tries to decide whether it has
reflected the 'new' RKEY it sees a different one from each unit.  By
clearing the rkey, it ensures that only the relation changed event from
the leader actually causes a restart.

Change-Id: I712502a666f23421cc58925f10b7643e3482d861
Closes-Bug: #1928383
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder refs/changes/10/841410/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: data = {CINDER_DB_INIT_ECHO_RKEY: init_id} # BUG: #1928383 - clear CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY if not the leader if not(is_elected_leader(CLUSTER_RES)): data[CINDER_DB_INIT_RKEY] = None relation_set(**data)
deleted_lines: relation_set(**{CINDER_DB_INIT_ECHO_RKEY: init_id})

commit_message:
Add package-upgrade action

The package-upgrade action performs package upgrades for the current
OpenStack release.

The code path used is similar to the openstack-upgrade action, with the
difference being that package-upgrade will not execute if an openstack
upgrade is available (based on the openstack-origin setting).

This change includes a charm-helpers sync.

Change-Id: I88ccffad7af2d2e9cddc1f6514ebd07898e117dc

commit_message:
Mark requirements newton branch as EOL

This seems to be missing for requirements and the branch is still
visible at opendev [1]. (However 'git checkout stable/newton' gives
some error for me locally). Let's try to clean up this branch.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commits/branch/stable/newton

commit_message:
Implement API protection testing for metadef properties

This commit adds some basic protection tests so that we can start
testing the secure RBAC changes proposed to glance.

Depends-On: Ic93c2a8a7017e6eac16d23fb5a9224d2c11e7211
Change-Id: I6c884ac57df29705549842cdca2dc0a5f50b68f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-tempest-plugin refs/changes/94/802794/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions from glance_tempest_plugin.tests.rbac.v2 import base as rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class MetadefV2RbacPropertiesTest(rbac_base.ImageV2RbacBaseTests, metaclass=abc.ABCMeta): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super().setup_clients() cls.persona = getattr(cls, f'os_{cls.credentials[0]}') cls.client = cls.persona.namespace_properties_client @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): super().setup_credentials() cls.os_primary = getattr(cls, f'os_{cls.credentials[0]}') @abc.abstractmethod def test_create_properties(self): """Test add_metadef_property policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_get_properties(self): """Test get_metadef_property policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_list_properties(self): """Test list_metadef_property policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_update_properties(self): """Test update_metadef_property policy.""" pass @abc.abstractmethod def test_delete_properties(self): """Test delete_metadef_property policy.""" pass class SystemAdminTests(MetadefV2RbacPropertiesTest, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_admin', 'project_admin'] @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_get_properties(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_list_properties(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_update_properties(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_create_properties(self): pass @decorators.skip_because(bug='968696') def test_delete_properties(self): pass class SystemMemberTests(SystemAdminTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_member', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] class SystemReaderTests(SystemMemberTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['system_reader', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] class ProjectAdminTests(MetadefV2RbacPropertiesTest, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_admin', 'system_admin'] def _create_properties(self, namespaces, client=None): properties = [] for namespace in namespaces: property_name = "property_of_%s" % (namespace['namespace']) self.do_request('create_namespace_property', expected_status=201, client=client, namespace=namespace['namespace'], name=property_name, title="property", type='integer') properties_with_ns = {} properties_with_ns['namespace'] = namespace properties_with_ns['property'] = property_name properties.append(properties_with_ns) self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace, namespace) return properties def test_create_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces by admin _ = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) _ = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) def test_get_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # Get all properties with admin role properties = properties_A + properties_B for prop in properties: self.do_request('show_namespace_properties', expected_status=200, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], property_name=prop['property']) def test_list_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # List all the properties with admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B properties_list = [] properties = properties_A + properties_B for namespace in namespaces: resp = self.do_request('list_namespace_properties', expected_status=200, namespace=namespace['namespace']) properties_list.append([*resp['properties']]) properties_list = [x for [x] in properties_list] for prop in properties: self.assertIn(prop['property'], properties_list) def test_update_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # Update properties with admin role properties = properties_A + properties_B for prop in properties: self.do_request('update_namespace_properties', expected_status=200, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], title="UPDATE_Property", name=prop['property'], property_name=prop['property'], type="string") def test_delete_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # Get all properties by admin role properties = properties_A + properties_B for prop in properties: self.do_request('delete_namespace_property', expected_status=204, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], property_name=prop['property']) class ProjectMemberTests(ProjectAdminTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_member', 'project_admin', 'system_admin'] def test_create_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties is not allowed for non admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B for namespace in namespaces: property_name = "property_of_%s" % (namespace['namespace']) self.do_request('create_namespace_property', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=namespace['namespace'], name=property_name, title="property", type='integer') self.addCleanup(self._cleanup_namespace, namespace) def test_get_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # Get all properties by Project C with admin role properties = properties_A + properties_B for prop in properties: if prop['namespace']['visibility'] == 'public': self.do_request('show_namespace_properties', expected_status=200, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], property_name=prop['property']) else: self.do_request('show_namespace_properties', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], property_name=prop['property']) project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') def test_list_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # List all the properties by Project C with non admin role namespaces = ns_A + ns_B properties_list = [] properties = properties_A + properties_B for namespace in namespaces: if namespace['visibility'] == 'public': resp = self.do_request('list_namespace_properties', expected_status=200, namespace=namespace['namespace']) properties_list.append([*resp['properties']]) else: self.do_request('list_namespace_properties', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=namespace['namespace']) properties_list = [x for [x] in properties_list] for prop in properties: if prop['namespace']['visibility'] == 'public': self.assertIn(prop['property'], properties_list) else: self.assertNotIn(prop['property'], properties_list) def test_update_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # Update by non admin role is not allowed properties = properties_A + properties_B for prop in properties: self.do_request('update_namespace_properties', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], title="UPDATE_Property", name=prop['property'], property_name=prop['property'], type="string") def test_delete_properties(self): project_client = self.setup_user_client(role='admin') # Create namespace by 2 different projects A & B ns_A, ns_B = self.create_namespaces(project_client=project_client) # Create properties for above created namespaces properties_A = self._create_properties( ns_A, client=self.namespace_properties_client) properties_B = self._create_properties( ns_B, client=project_client.namespace_properties_client) # Delete properties is not allowed by non admin role properties = properties_A + properties_B for prop in properties: self.do_request('delete_namespace_property', expected_status=exceptions.Forbidden, namespace=prop['namespace']['namespace'], property_name=prop['property']) class ProjectReaderTests(ProjectMemberTests, rbac_base.BaseV2MetadefTest): credentials = ['project_reader', 'project_admin', 'system_admin']

commit_message:
Switch libvirt event timeout message to warning

At the moment, if libvirt times out in detaching a device, it
reports this as an ERROR even if the process will be retried
and eventually succeed.

We should just log a warning since there's nothing to do, and
if the process fails after all the retries, it will log an ERROR
anyways.

Closes-Bug: #1972023
Change-Id: Idda12db5758706a97b7841571b9ecd3dc6e6905e

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], dropping
the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Co-Authored-By: Manpreet Kaur <kaurmanpreet2620@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iff303aee59ca9232e10e41d478f04abb085b9051

commit_message:
Remove release names starting from 2023.1 release

It was discussed in the April 2022 PTG [1] and finally it was decided
that release names, even they are good from the marketing point of view,
makes a lot of troubles every cycle to choose something which would be
appropropriate for everyone.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L265

Change-Id: I1eee82afaa20a06bd1a2d0b4b0886e5c2cd44545
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/97/839897/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: identification code: "year"."release count within the year". Releases will not have any other name except that numeric version.* OpenStack 2023.1of the year.* OpenStack 2023.2 * OpenStack 2024.1The release identification schema replaces the release name. It's an unambiguous way to identify OpenStack releases and will not cause any problems with choosing release names.
deleted_lines: identification code: "year"."release count within the year"* OpenStack 2023.1 Axxxxof the year and "Axxxx" is the release name following the release name rules.* OpenStack 2023.2 Bxxxx * OpenStack 2024.1 CxxxxThe release identification schema doesn't replace the release name. It's just an unambiguous way to identify OpenStack releases. Release Name ------------ Each OpenStack development cycle has a code-name that is proposed and chosen by the community. This name is frequently used in preference to version numbers to refer to the release at the end of the cycle. The process of choosing the name should be an enjoyable activity for the community to mark the software development cycle, and the name itself should be fun to use. Because the name will become associated with OpenStack, and a particular release, the process should consider potential issues of trademark. Release Naming Process ---------------------- #. Anyone may propose a name that matches the `Release Name Criteria`_. Proposed names should be added to a page on the OpenStack wiki. #. A Condorcet election is held to rank the names. The electorate will be Technical Committee, and the poll should be run in a manner that allows members of the community to see what each TC member voted for. #. The Foundation will perform a trademark check on the winning name. If there is a trademark conflict, then the Foundation will proceed down the ranked list of Condorcet results until a name without a trademark conflict is found. This will be the selected name. Release Name Criteria --------------------- The following rules are designed to provide some consistency in the pattern used to select release names, provide a fun challenge in finding names that meet the criteria, and prevent unwieldy names from being chosen. #. Each release name must start with the letter of the ISO basic Latin alphabet following the initial letter of the previous release, starting with the initial release of "Austin". After "Z", the next name should start with "A" again. #. A release name can't be repeated between different iterations of the alphabet. #. The name must be composed only of the 26 characters of the ISO basic Latin alphabet. Names which can be transliterated into this character set are also acceptable. #. The name must be a single word with a maximum length of 10 characters.

Disable auto discovery as a workaround

Same issue surfaced with setuptools 61.0 (see related bz).

The workaround as mentioned in [1] seems to do the trick.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Related-Bug: #1966382

commit_message:
Don't create ironic_tftp_master_path directory, change default

This will be created by ironic on startup. Not creating it here is
consistent with the move to have ironic be responsible for its own
setup/config where possible.

This commit also changes the bifrost default ironic_tftp_master_path
of /var/lib/ironic/master_images to the ironic [pxe]tftp_master_path
default of /tftpboot/master_images. This fixes a permission denied
issue when selinux is enforcing, since dnsmasq cannot access image
files with type var_lib_t.

Change-Id: I54c2f3ed417156d0130eb0e5b400cfc2a09b51fc

commit_message:
Dropped the python 3.6/3.7 in zed cycle testing runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Ic8cf4bf0ba12043d15e1ff31832f42cc14b3e021

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Idd51e189d7e8dc5626a831c06a5a47ae5a11f5f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/56/787056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: envlist = py37,pep8,releasenotes

While using relative path in order to specify auth_openidc_module

works fine.
apache2 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-auth-openidc 2.4.1-1

Change-Id: I19cacd525fc4da3737ac0b3eec921d411164c524

commit_message:
Update auth_openidc_module path

While using relative path in order to specify auth_openidc_module
path it seems to be relativ to the ServerRoot dir. Hence the module
is not loaded and Apache2 fail to start. Using an absolute path
works fine.
apache2 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-auth-openidc 2.4.1-1

Change-Id: I19cacd525fc4da3737ac0b3eec921d411164c524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/15/758115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LoadModule auth_openidc_module /usr/lib/apache2/modules/mod_auth_openidc.so
deleted_lines: LoadModule auth_openidc_module modules/mod_auth_openidc.so

commit_message:
WIP: Move common settings out of api class and into init

Current setup isn't usable if you have different hosts running
api and worker. Also bring it more into line with other
puppet modules.

Change-Id: I0dacf7d0e36426dd6b2d2239dceeb11c45be9bd9
TODO: tests, backwards compat
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/10/712210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

An example rabbit url # would be, rabbit://user:pass@host:port/virtual_host # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*rpc_response_timeout*] # (Optional) Seconds to wait for a response from a call. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*control_exchange*] # (Optional) The default exchange under which topics are scoped. May be # overridden by an exchange name specified in the transport_url # option. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*notification_transport_url*] # (optional) Connection url for oslo messaging notifications backend. An # example rabbit url would be, rabbit://user:pass@host:port/virtual_host # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*notification_driver*] # (optional) Driver to use for oslo messaging notifications backend. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*notification_topics*] # (optional) Topics to use for oslo messaging notifications backend. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*rabbit_use_ssl*] # (optional) Connect over SSL for RabbitMQ # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*rabbit_ha_queues*] # (optional) Use HA queues in RabbitMQ. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold*] # (optional) Number of seconds after which the RabbitMQ broker is considered # down if the heartbeat keepalive fails. Any value >0 enables heartbeats. # Heartbeating helps to ensure the TCP connection to RabbitMQ isn't silently # closed, resulting in missed or lost messages from the queue. # (Requires kombu >= 3.0.7 and amqp >= 1.4.0) # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*rabbit_heartbeat_rate*] # (optional) How often during the rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold period to # check the heartbeat on RabbitMQ connection. (i.e. rabbit_heartbeat_rate=2 # when rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold=60, the heartbeat will be checked # every 30 seconds. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread*] # (Optional) EXPERIMENTAL: Run the health check heartbeat thread # through a native python thread. By default if this # option isn't provided the health check heartbeat will # inherit the execution model from the parent process. Multiple plugins # are defined in a list eg. ['store_crypto', dogtag_crypto'] # Used when multiple_secret_stores_enabled is not set to true. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*enabled_crypto_plugins*] # (optional) Enabled crypto_plugins. Multiple plugins # are defined in a list eg. ['simple_crypto','p11_crypto'] # Used when multiple_secret_stores_enabled is not set to true. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*enabled_secret_stores*] # (optional) Enabled secretstores. This is the configuration # parameters when multiple plugin configuration is used. # Suffixes are defined in a comma separated list eg. # 'simple_crypto,dogtag,kmip,pkcs11' # Defaults to 'simple_crypto' # # [*multiple_secret_stores_enabled*] # (optional) Enabled crypto_plugins. Multiple plugins # are defined in a list eg. ['simple_crypto','p11_crypto'] # Defaults to false # # [*enabled_certificate_plugins*] # (optional) Enabled certificate plugins as a list. # e.g. ['snakeoil_ca', 'dogtag'] # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*enabled_certificate_event_plugins*] # (optional) Enabled certificate event plugins as a list # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_ssl_ca_certs*] # (optional) SSL certification authority file (valid only if SSL enabled). # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_ssl_certfile*] # (optional) SSL cert file (valid only if SSL enabled). # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_ssl_keyfile*] # (optional) SSL key file (valid only if SSL enabled). # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_ssl_version*] # (optional) SSL version to use (valid only if SSL enabled). # Valid values are TLSv1, SSLv23 and SSLv3. SSLv2 may be # available on some distributions. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_reconnect_delay*] # (optional) How long to wait before reconnecting in response to an AMQP # consumer cancel notification. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_failover_strategy*] # (Optional) Determines how the next RabbitMQ node is chosen in case the one # we are currently connected to becomes unavailable. Takes effect only if # more than one RabbitMQ node is provided in config. (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*kombu_compression*] # (optional) Possible values are: gzip, bz2. If not set compression will not # be used. This option may notbe available in future versions. EXPERIMENTAL. # (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*sync_db*] # (optional) Run barbican-db-manage on api nodes. # Defaults to true # # [*db_auto_create*] # (optional) Barbican API server option to create the database # automatically when the server starts. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # class barbican ( $max_allowed_secret_in_bytes = $::os_service_default, $notification_transport_url = $::os_service_default, $notification_driver = $::os_service_default, $notification_topics = $::os_service_default, $rabbit_use_ssl = $::os_service_default, $rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold = $::os_service_default, $rabbit_heartbeat_rate = $::os_service_default, $rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread = $::os_service_default, $rabbit_ha_queues = $::os_service_default, $amqp_durable_queues = $::os_service_default, $enable_queue = $::os_service_default, $queue_namespace = $::os_service_default, $queue_topic = $::os_service_default, $queue_version = $::os_service_default, $queue_server_name = $::os_service_default, $retry_scheduler_initial_delay_seconds = $::os_service_default, $retry_scheduler_periodic_interval_max_seconds = $::os_service_default, $enabled_secretstore_plugins = $::os_service_default, $enabled_crypto_plugins = $::os_service_default, $enabled_secret_stores = 'simple_crypto', $multiple_secret_stores_enabled = false, $enabled_certificate_plugins = $::os_service_default, $enabled_certificate_event_plugins = $::os_service_default, $kombu_ssl_ca_certs = $::os_service_default, $kombu_ssl_certfile = $::os_service_default, $kombu_ssl_keyfile = $::os_service_default, $kombu_ssl_version = $::os_service_default, $kombu_reconnect_delay = $::os_service_default, $kombu_failover_strategy = $::os_service_default, $kombu_compression = $::os_service_default, $sync_db = true, $db_auto_create = $::os_service_default, ) { include barbican::db oslo::messaging::rabbit {'barbican_config': rabbit_use_ssl => $rabbit_use_ssl, heartbeat_timeout_threshold => $rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold, heartbeat_rate => $rabbit_heartbeat_rate, heartbeat_in_pthread => $rabbit_heartbeat_in_pthread, kombu_reconnect_delay => $kombu_reconnect_delay, kombu_failover_strategy => $kombu_failover_strategy, amqp_durable_queues => $amqp_durable_queues, kombu_compression => $kombu_compression, kombu_ssl_ca_certs => $kombu_ssl_ca_certs, kombu_ssl_certfile => $kombu_ssl_certfile, kombu_ssl_keyfile => $kombu_ssl_keyfile, kombu_ssl_version => $kombu_ssl_version, rabbit_ha_queues => $rabbit_ha_queues, } oslo::messaging::default { 'barbican_config': transport_url => $default_transport_url, rpc_response_timeout => $rpc_response_timeout, control_exchange => $control_exchange, } oslo::messaging::notifications { 'barbican_config': driver => $notification_driver, transport_url => $notification_transport_url, topics => $notification_topics, } # queue options barbican_config { 'queue/enable': value => $enable_queue; 'queue/namespace': value => $queue_namespace; 'queue/topic': value => $queue_topic; 'queue/version': value => $queue_version; 'queue/server_name': value => $queue_server_name; } # retry scheduler and max allowed secret options barbican_config { 'retry_scheduler/initial_delay_seconds': value => $retry_scheduler_initial_delay_seconds; 'retry_scheduler/periodic_interval_max_seconds': value => $retry_scheduler_periodic_interval_max_seconds; 'DEFAULT/max_allowed_secret_in_bytes': value => $max_allowed_secret_in_bytes; 'DEFAULT/max_allowed_request_size_in_bytes': value => $max_allowed_request_size_in_bytes; } if $multiple_secret_stores_enabled and !is_service_default($enabled_secretstore_plugins) { warning("barbican::api::enabled_secretstore_plugins and barbican::api::enabled_crypto_plugins \ will be set by puppet, but will not be used by the server whenever \ barbican::api::multiple_secret_stores_enabled is set to true. Use \ barbican::api::enabled_secret_stores instead") } # enabled plugins barbican_config { 'secretstore/enabled_secretstore_plugins': value => $enabled_secretstore_plugins; 'crypto/enabled_crypto_plugins': value => $enabled_crypto_plugins; 'certificate/enabled_certificate_plugins': value => $enabled_certificate_plugins; 'certificate_event/enabled_certificate_event_plugins': value => $enabled_certificate_event_plugins; } # enabled plugins when multiple plugins is enabled barbican_config { 'secretstore/enable_multiple_secret_stores': value => $multiple_secret_stores_enabled; 'secretstore/stores_lookup_suffix': value => $enabled_secret_stores; } # set value to have the server auto-create the database on startup # instead of using db_sync barbican_config { 'DEFAULT/db_auto_create': value => $db_auto_create } if $sync_db { include barbican::db::sync }
deleted_lines: # [*sample_parameter*] # Explanation of what this parameter affects and what it defaults to.class barbican {

subject: Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-27 13:14:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/bbb315df34e274e5e17cefad3488085834753ea3', 'message': 'Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error

As part of the effort agreed in the last PTG to simplify and properly
define the driver interface this patch consolidates methods do_setup and
check_for_setup_error in a single method called setup.

The reason to consolidate both methods is that they are always called
one right after the other, os there was no real reason to force the
drivers to split things in a particular way.

This patch provides a basic backward compatible "setup" implementation
that calls "do_setup" and "check_for_setup_error" if they exist.

We could just update the base driver and interface classes, but then we
risk new driver implementations using existing driers as reference and
perpetuating the split of the methods, so the patch actually
consolidates the methods for most (not all) of the drivers.

To avoid getting docstrings from the driver and the interface (which is
the one used for the documentation) out of sync we replace the
description on cinder/volume/driver.py with a text referencing the
interface docstring.

Change-Id: Icdbcae7cf9644ff9c21712df6cc66dc64f7e9556

'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/0123012ccb281a0375af27fa4a9444c155fc5a24', 'message': 'Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error

As part of the effort agreed in the last PTG to simplify and properly
define the driver interface this patch consolidates methods do_setup and
check_for_setup_error in a single method called setup.

The reason to consolidate both methods is that they are always called
one right after the other, as there was no real reason to force the
drivers to split things in a particular way.

This patch provides a basic backward compatible "setup" implementation
that calls "do_setup" and "check_for_setup_error" if they exist.

We could just update the base driver and interface classes, but then we
risk new driver implementations using existing drivers as reference and
perpetuating the split of the methods, so the patch actually
consolidates the methods for most (not all) of the drivers.

To avoid getting docstrings from the driver and the interface (which is
the one used for the documentation) out of sync we replace the

commit_message:
Join do_setup and check_for_setup_error

As part of the effort agreed in the last PTG to simplify and properly
define the driver interface this patch consolidates methods do_setup and
check_for_setup_error in a single method called setup.

The reason to consolidate both methods is that they are always called
one right after the other, as there was no real reason to force the
drivers to split things in a particular way.

This patch provides a basic backward compatible "setup" implementation
that calls "do_setup" and "check_for_setup_error" if they exist.

We could just update the base driver and interface classes, but then we
risk new driver implementations using existing drivers as reference and
perpetuating the split of the methods, so the patch actually
consolidates the methods for most (not all) of the drivers.

To avoid getting docstrings from the driver and the interface (which is
the one used for the documentation) out of sync we replace the
description on cinder/volume/driver.py with a text referencing the
interface docstring.

Depends-On: Id037c1b8a570eea704c136f35ac0b262ca5b0dfa
Change-Id: Icdbcae7cf9644ff9c21712df6cc66dc64f7e9556
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/815659/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setup(self, context): super(RemoteFSDriver, self).setup(context) def setup(self, context): super(RemoteFSSnapDriverBase, self).setup(context)
deleted_lines: def check_for_setup_error(self): """Just to override parent behavior.""" pass def do_setup(self, context): super(RemoteFSDriver, self).do_setup(context) def do_setup(self, context): super(RemoteFSSnapDriverBase, self).do_setup(context)

commit_message:
[L3HA] Don't update HA router's ports if router isn't active on agents

In case when HA router isn't active on any L3 agent,
_ensure_host_set_on_port method shouldn't try to update port's host to
the host from which there was an rpc message sent, as this can be host
on which router is in the "standby" mode.
This method should only update port's host to the router's "active_host"
if there is such active_host found already.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/841489

Closes-Bug: #1973162
Closes-Bug: #1942190
Change-Id: Ib3945d294601b35f9b268c25841cd284b52c4ca3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/841712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not active_host: LOG.debug("Router %s is not active an any host. " "Port %s will not be updated now.", router_id, port['id']) return "host": active_host}) {'port': {portbindings.HOST_ID: active_host}})
deleted_lines: if active_host: host = active_host "host": host}) {'port': {portbindings.HOST_ID: host}})

commit_message:
Fix malformed OIDCMemCacheServers

Change from comma separated list of memcache servers to space separated list.
Comma seperated list results in a 500 error response.
Upstream docs state this should be space separated and can be found here:
https://github.com/zmartzone/mod_auth_openidc/blob/master/auth_openidc.conf#L629-L631

Closes-Bug: #1972033
Change-Id: Ibaef3672c656213dd5ba1488379d686130e041c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/95/840995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OIDCMemCacheServers "{% for host in groups['memcached'] %}{{ 'api' | kolla_address(host) | put_address_in_context('memcache') }}:{{ memcached_port }}{% if not loop.last %} {% endif %}{% endfor %}"
deleted_lines: OIDCMemCacheServers "{% for host in groups['memcached'] %}{{ 'api' | kolla_address(host) | put_address_in_context('memcache') }}:{{ memcached_port }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}"

commit_message:
Save COMPOSE_ID info after setting up repos

This patch adds a command to save current COMPOSE_ID configured in the
mirrors at the moment that the job is being executed.
This information can be useful when comparing new failures with previous
success or failed jobs.

Change-Id: I804f4ae26846734f6e182da9c44ff77426dabce4
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/39/841639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Save Compose-ID info sudo curl -s -o /etc/yum.repos.d/COMPOSE_ID ${NODEPOOL_CENTOS_MIRROR}/8-stream/COMPOSE_ID

commit_message:
[APIImpact] Add a new glance-download import method

Implements: blueprint glance-download-import

Change-Id: I46c8e5e6a04d97d6968f7586c2fbd661f3813ca0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/32/836132/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== Glance download import ====================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/glance-download-import This spec describe a new import method called glance-download that implement a glance to glance download in a multi-region cloud with a federated Keystone. Problem description =================== When dealing with a multi-region cloud it often appear that operators or customers need to copy images from a region to another. It is currently complicated to implement as customer need to save the image locally, then upload it on the new region. We propose to implement a new import method called glance-download based on the web-download import method that will download the image from a remote glance. Note that this first version require to have a federated Keystone between the two Glance to avoid authentications problematics (we rely on context token to authenticate on the remote glance) Proposed change =============== Implement an internal plugin called glance-download based on the existing internal plugin web-download that will import an image stored on a remote glance. We should note two things: * to authenticate on the remote glance we propose to use the context token of the call * the creation of the image must be handled by the end user as for the web-download plugin meaning that it is of the reponsibility of the user to take care of disk format, container format and metadata of the newly created image. Alternatives ------------ The context of this use case is very specific to a multi-region cloud. We could imagine a more generic way of copying (exporting/importing) that will work for glances behind different keystones but needs a more complex development. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Modification of existing API resource * Resource **/v2/images/<image id>/import** * Method: **POST** * Common response code: * *201*: import job queued * *400*: bad request with details * *401*: Unauthorized * *403*: Forbidden * JSON body definition .. code-block:: JSON "method": { "name": { "description": "Name of the method used, here is glance-download", "type": "string" }, "glance_image_id": { "description": "The image id to download on remote glance", "type": "string" }, "glance_region": { "description": "The region name of remote glance", "type": "string" }, "glance_service_interface": { "decription": "The interface of remote glance, default to 'public'", "type": "string", } } .. Exemple: .. code-block:: JSON "method": { "name": "glance-download", "glance_image_id": 02ea04ba-72b3-4687-810d-8ba10c991a97, "glance_region": "REGION1", "glance_service_interface": "admin" } .. Security impact --------------- We use the token of the request to authenticate on remote glance. As we are in multi-region context with a federated keystone, there is no security impact. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Update glanceclient and openstackclient to support this new feature. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: pslestang Other contributors: alistarle Work Items ---------- * glance: * Create a base download class that will be inherited by web-download and glance-download * Patch the web-download class to inherit from base download class * Write the glance-download class * Patch the api image import to support the glance-download method * Patch the v2 image api to support the glance-download method * Add the glance-download internal plugin in setup * write unit/functional tests * update documentation * glance and openstack client * add support to glance-download method * update documentation Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit and functional tests in Glance Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation need to be updated to identify this new import method References ==========

commit_message:
Add spec about how to support kube-proxy

Change-Id: I2a9d4665f701f9690da9e36b5b7de32da773192b
Implements: blueprint support-kube-proxy
Related-Bug: #1964564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/61/833961/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Convention for heading levels in Neutron devref: ======= Heading 0 (reserved for the title in a document) ------- Heading 1 ~~~~~~~ Heading 2 +++++++ Heading 3 ''''''' Heading 4 (Avoid deeper levels because they do not render well.) ================================================================= Support kube-proxy on openvswitch/linuxbridge backend environment ================================================================= Purpose ------- The purpose of the document is to present the design details about how to support raw `kube-proxy` with `kuryr-kubernetes`. The main purpose of using raw `kube-proxy` is to reduce resource consumption. In `openvswitch/linuxbridge` backend environment `kuryr-kubernetes` use octavia's amphora backend loadbalancer to implement k8s service. Each amphora backend loadbalancer need consume one or two VMs, this is very heavy for user. So, in order to decrease the cost for user, I propose the following changes. Proposed Solution ----------------- The `kube-proxy` apply related rule on host node. So, the first thing is that we need ensure the connectivity between host node and pod. For the purpose, I propose a new configuration option `host_subnet`, the configuration option's value is a subnet id, `kuryr-kubernetes` need to create a neutron port for each host nodes, and the tap device corresponding to the neutron port should be maintained by `kuryr-daemon`, when `kuryr-daemon` start up, it should check and configure the tap device. Moreover, the `host subnet` should be connected to the pod router which specified by `pod_router` configuration option. So, the host node and pod's network topology graph will like below:: +--------------+ | | +-------------------+ pod router +-------------+ | | | | | +------+-------+ | | | | | | | +-+-------+--------+--+ +-------+--+------+ +-----+--+--------+ | host subnet | | ns1 subnet | ns2 subnet | | | | | | | | +----+-----+ +-----+----+ +-+--+ +-+--+ | | | | | | | | |host node1| |host node2| |pod1| |pod2| | | | | | | | | +----------+ +----------+ +----+ +----+ The above graph suppose the pod subnet driver is namespace. the `ns1 subnet`` and `ns2 subnet` is the k8s namespace subnet, The CIDRs of these subnets should be allocated from one same subnet pool which specified by `pod_subnet_pool`. Suppose that: The subnet pool's prefixes are: 10.0.0.0/22. The host subnet's cidr is: 10.0.1.0/24 The ns1 subnet's cidr is: 10.0.2.0/24 The ns2 subnet's cidr is: 10.0.3.0/24 The IP address of host node1's tap device is: 10.0.1.1 The IP address of host node2's tap device is: 10.0.1.2 The host subnet's gateway is: 10.0.1.254 The k8s service's cidr is: 172.18.0.0/16 Has a k8s service and it's cluster ip is: 172.18.0.1 The tap device's name is: k-host The pod1's ip address is: 10.0.2.1 The pod2's ip address is: 10.0.3.1 In order to the traffic can be forwarded to `pod1` and `pod2` from the host node, the below route should be added in each host node:: 10.0.0.0/22 via 10.0.1.254 The another significant thing is how to ensure the pod can access the another pod by k8s service's cluster IP, the traffic path like: pod1 -> service -> pod2. Because the k8s service's cluster IP located in each host node, so `kuryr-kubernetes` should add the below route on the pod router:: 172.18.0.0/16 via 10.0.1.1 10.0.1.2 This is a ECMP route, by the route the pod can access any host node's k8s service cluster ip. Suppose, the request traffic be forwarded to host node1, and the host node1 forward it to pod2, in order to ensuser the response traffic can reture host node1, we need to modify the traffic's source ip to address of tap device of host node1. So, the below iptables rule should be added in host node1 by `kuryr-daemon`:: -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o k-host -j SNAT --to-source 10.0.1.1 The host node2:: -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o k-host -j SNAT --to-source 10.0.1.2 The complete traffic path like below:: ipvs rules ECMP route d: 172.18.0.1->10.0.3.1 172.18.0.0/16 via s: 10.0.2.1->172.18.0.1 10.0.1.1 kuryr iptables rules 1 10.0.1.2 2 s: 172.18.0.1->10.0.1.1 +----+ s:10.0.2.1 +----------+ s:10.0.2.1 +----------+ | | d:172.18.0.1 | | d:172.18.0.1 | | |pod1+-------------->+pod router+------------------>+host node1| | | | | | | +----+ +----------+ +----+-----+ | 3 |s:10.0.1.1 |d:10.0.3.1 5 4 v +----------+ s:10.0.3.1 +----+ s:10.0.1.1 +----+-----+ | | d:10.0.1.1 | | d:10.0.3.1 | | |pod router+<------------+pod2+<------------------+pod router| | | | | | | +---+------+ +----+ +----------+ | 6 |s:10.0.3.1 |d:10.0.1.1 | v 7 8 +----+-----+ s:172.18.0.1 +----------+ s:172.18.0.1+----+ | | d:10.0.2.1 | | d:10.0.2.1 | | |host node1+------------->+pod router+------------>+pod1| | | | | | | +----------+ +----------+ +----+ As above graph, the source ip of the response traffic from host node1 to pod1 is 172.18.0.1, so the allowed address 172.18.0.0/16 should be added to the neutron port which corresponding to host node tap device. The ingress rule which has remote ip 172.18.0.0/16 should be added to the neutron port's security group.

commit_message:
Deprecate ineffective ManilaCephFSCephFSEnableSnapshots

The cephfs_enable_snapshots parameter was deprecated in Manila[1]
during Victoria and was removed during Wallaby. Now Manila always
enables snapshot support for CephFS backend. Following that deprecation
in Manila, the corresponding parameter of puppet-manila was deprecated
during the Victoria cycle [2] and it is being removed during the Xena
cycle.

This deprecates the corresponding parameter from tripleo-heat-tempaltes
because it has no effect since Wallaby.

[1] 2d7c46445396b0db780ba456ffb9284b177a6ae4

commit_message:
Replace distutils with packaging in 3rd party drivers

PEP632 defines the deprecation of `distutils` from Python 3.10
and complete removal from Python 3.12.

This patch preempts any future issues and follows the long
standing recommendation to replace distutils with setuptools
(packaging in the case of version string checking)

Change-Id: Ie455f3f32a0681d2d7eb54344f9186d09d3de80f

commit_message:
Add support for Pure Storage FlashArray backend to Cinder

Add an enable_cinder_backend_pure_iscsi and
enable_cinder_backend_pure_fc options to etc/kolla/globals.yml
to enable use of the FlashArray backend.
Update the documentation to include a section on configuring
Cinder with the FlashArray.

Implements: blueprint pure-cinder-driver
Change-Id: I464733f1322237321ed1ffff8636cf30bd1cbb38

commit_message:
Fix standby node regex for check_crm

Pacemaker has changed the output format of crm_mon and this broke
the regex to catch nodes that are on standby mode. This change
updates the regex for not alerting on paused units.

Change-Id: I137acad076bff58506fea6e1618a00765adacd9b
Closes-Bug: #1971182
Related-Bug: #1880576
(cherry picked from commit a0b419519cd438affb24ff80c0221cc33d884c9a)

subject: Prevent errors when private-address=None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 13:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster/commit/07b7e5e367bde8d15ea7a2c1b631038c73158217', 'message': 'Prevent errors when private-address=None

Whenever a peer returns None as its IP, it results in
misconfiguration in corosync.conf, which results in
a series of cascading hook errors that are difficult to
sort out.

More specifically, this usually happens when network-get
does not work for the current binding. The main problem
is that when changing bindings, a hook fires before the
network-get data is updated. This hook fails and prevents
the network-get from being re-read.

This patch changes the code behavior to ignore None IP
entries, therefore gracefully exiting and deferring further
configuration due to insufficient number of peers when that
happens, so that a later hook can successfully read the IP
from the relation and set the IPs correctly in corosync.

Closes-bug: #1961448
Change-Id: I5ed140a17e184fcf6954d0f66e25f74564bd281c
(cherry picked from commit d54de3d3464352ca07e4b9d9f6a5c8350464b29b)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent errors when private-address=None

Whenever a peer returns None as its IP, it results in
misconfiguration in corosync.conf, which results in
a series of cascading hook errors that are difficult to
sort out.

More specifically, this usually happens when network-get
does not work for the current binding. The main problem
is that when changing bindings, a hook fires before the
network-get data is updated. This hook fails and prevents
the network-get from being re-read.

This patch changes the code behavior to ignore None IP
entries, therefore gracefully exiting and deferring further
configuration due to insufficient number of peers when that
happens, so that a later hook can successfully read the IP
from the relation and set the IPs correctly in corosync.

Closes-bug: #1961448
Change-Id: I5ed140a17e184fcf6954d0f66e25f74564bd281c
(cherry picked from commit d54de3d3464352ca07e4b9d9f6a5c8350464b29b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster refs/changes/88/841588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 13:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'templates/corosync.conf', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_hooks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster/commit/567e54d87c55f945f222a9ebbe2e9bfc1984ce5e', 'message': "Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install

Starting in focal, the ubuntu version of corosync package synced in from
debian includes node1 as the default name for the local node with a nodeid
of 1. This causes the cluster to have knowledge of this extra node1 node,
which affects quorum, etc. Installing the charm's corosync.conf file
before package installation prevents this conditioning from happening.

Additionally this change removes some Xenial bits in the charm and always
includes a nodelist in corosync.conf as it is compulsory in focal and
newer. It is optional in the bionic packages, so we'll always just
render the nodelist.

Change-Id: I06b9c23eb57274f0c99a3a05979c0cabf87c8118
Closes-Bug: #1874719
(cherry picked from commit d1191dbcabdfd8684a86825f06c6ede266ba93ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Render corosync.conf file prior to pkg install

Starting in focal, the ubuntu version of corosync package synced in from
debian includes node1 as the default name for the local node with a nodeid
of 1. This causes the cluster to have knowledge of this extra node1 node,
which affects quorum, etc. Installing the charm's corosync.conf file
before package installation prevents this conditioning from happening.

Additionally this change removes some Xenial bits in the charm and always
includes a nodelist in corosync.conf as it is compulsory in focal and
newer. It is optional in the bionic packages, so we'll always just
render the nodelist.

Change-Id: I06b9c23eb57274f0c99a3a05979c0cabf87c8118
Closes-Bug: #1874719
(cherry picked from commit d1191dbcabdfd8684a86825f06c6ede266ba93ba)

commit_message:
Don't bootstrap osds on mon-relation-departed hook

The charm attempts to bootstrap OSDs on both the mon-relation-changed
and the mon-relation-departed hooks. There is no logical reason that
the OSDs should be bootstrapped in the -departed hook.

Change-Id: I79a790291b0e361d2748d6bed8c989d16ad36daf
Closes-Bug: #1885195

subject: Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-13 15:54:57.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/connection.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/e1a0d7c85783e87be6ca440f223d37ba2e2a888f', 'message': "Add cooperative_yield() to OvsdbIdl

On python-ovs 2.16.0+, overriding cooperative_yield() will allow
potentially long-running CPU-intensive methods to cooperatively
yield to greenthreads. This patch + ovs 2.16.0+ will resolve
the related bug. I'll see if I can get cooperative_yield

commit_message:
Adding testing on build_catalog

To help with finding issues with this function we should test it.

Change-Id: I9059568eefc3626691a445d022e544f202936839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/66/837866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_build_catalog(self): prefix = 'docker://localhost:8787/t' url1 = urlparse('%s/nova-api:latest' % prefix) url2 = urlparse('%s/namespace/nova-compute:abc' % prefix) url3 = urlparse('%s/yet/another/namespace/nova-compute:abc' % prefix) manifest = { 'schemaVersion': 1, 'fsLayers': [ {'blobSum': 'sha256:aeb786'}, {'blobSum': 'sha256:4dc536'}, ], 'mediaType': 'application/vnd.docker.' 'distribution.manifest.v2+json', } self._write_test_image( url=url1, manifest=manifest ) self._write_test_image( url=url2, manifest=manifest ) self._write_test_image( url=url3, manifest=manifest ) image_export.build_catalog() catalog = os.path.join(image_export.IMAGE_EXPORT_DIR, 'v2', '_catalog') with open(catalog, 'r') as f: data = json.load(f) self.assertListEqual( data['repositories'], [ 't/namespace/nova-compute', 't/yet/another/namespace/nova-compute', 't/nova-api' ])

commit_message:
Comment out ssh code in use-it script

With the move to using Ubuntu 20.04, the current way that
we test openstack with the use-it script does not seem
to work correctly. While we come up with a better solution,
this change comments out the ssh related functions.

Change-Id: I57caf7fbd0d95db778ce66b2b05f3bd8a346bcd8

commit_message:
Prevent the enroll/deploy commands from running without venv

Running them without sourcing the venv configuration results in a very
confusing error message from ansible. Prevent that.

Change-Id: I0cc408b475134eb76d3229b9cccefb9555b4bcba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/99/839399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Manila: Deprecate ineffctive *DriverHandlesShareServers

In puppet-manila, the driver_handlers_share_servers parameter have been
deprecated for some backends[1] because these backends can only accept
true or false and accpepting arbitrary value results in manila service
failing to start.
This change deprecate the corresponding parameters in template files so
that we can remove usage of these deprecated parameters.

[1] 4c365c9064845e73a1da0f868ebba5a00c6a5c7a

NOTE(stable/wallaby):

commit_message:
Stop generating certificate requests for disabled networks

The certificate requests created based on ApacheNetworks require fqdn_NETWORK to be set.
The will only be defined for the networks that are enabled for the current role.

Currently requests are generated for all networks. This happens to work for the Controller role
as all networks are enabled. However it fails on DCN compute nodes that are not on the external
network (they use apache for local glance-api services).

Change-Id: I05ba5fb48c617a5bbedebb8b74c23bec9abf3bbd

commit_message:
accept ssh diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 and update cert-manager

openssh-client, etc. updated and might not accept these algos by
default. Cirros images should probably be updated at some point to
use a new SSH server.

Update cert-manager to 1.8.0 because [1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh`
to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

Upgrade cert-manager so it uses admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1 instead.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I5ea204bbcd7add2f787df79ac1d996842f4d1fcc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/31/841631/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # accept diffie-hellman-group1-sha1 algo for SSH (cirros image should probably be updated to replace this) sudo echo " KexAlgorithms +diffie-hellman-group1-sha1" >> /etc/ssh/ssh_config

commit_message:
Adds new scenario test to the Zones suite + minor refactoring

Test name: "test_create_and_update_zone"
   1. Create a Zone using particular TTL and Description values.
   2. Update Zone's TTL and Description.
   3. Make sure that the updated values presents in "Show Zone".

Change-Id: Ic9aa12eb9fd9cdad8f6f765cc98de20b272aaf33

added_lines: Enabling a trivial Swift on Ceph Storage via RadosGW can be done in a few steps with the help of the `cephadm guides <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/cephadm/services/rgw/>`.After a few moments your rgw clients should be created. You can find them by searching for client.rgw and finding clients such as: client.rgw.<hostname>.abcdefAt this point you will need to apply your `ceph configurations <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/keystone/#integrating-with-openstack-keystone>` to each of your clients found above and `client.rgw.default`. These configurations will allow you to use keystone as a backend and instantiate basic settings. Once complete, restart rgw hosts to apply the settings.Enable the following swift options in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml`` and enter all of your rgw hosts as well:Once deploy is complete, verify that your endpoints are created successfully and have the correct endpoint address.
deleted_lines: Enabling a trivial Swift on Ceph Storage via RadosGW can be done in a few steps with the help of the `cephadm guides <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/cephadm/services/rgw/>`.After a few moments your rgw clients should be created. You can find them by searching for client.rgw and finding clients such as: client.rgw.<hostname>.abcdefAt this point you will need to apply your `ceph configurations <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/keystone/#integrating-with-openstack-keystone>` to each of your clients found above and `client.rgw.default`. These configurations will allow you to use keystone as a backend and instantiate basic settings. Once complete, restart rgw hosts to apply the settings.Enable the following swift options in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml`` and enter all of your rgw hosts as well:Once deploy is complete, verify that your endpoints are created successfully and have the correct endpoint address.

commit_message:
Add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ica6a46ae7de3c7e16a75efcca27695a1378474ef

commit_message:
Add tripleo_container_standalone role

The tripleo_container_standalone role is used to manage TripleO
containers defined by other standalone Ansible roles instead of these
container definitions being defined in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-On: I3e6dba0539b9622433ce74e18b5fbdc05e5bcaaf
Change-Id: I119dbf19b4fd3b8320811bba284e40fa07d2d79a
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/05/838905/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I3f72768442b3690f8ec85d5d15102ae6825dddd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-designateclient refs/changes/43/840043/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

squash commits and fix whitespace

Closes-Bug: #1970250
Change-Id: Ic6d59dca1bb83866d085f2eba64724899edbae40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/00/839400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RadosGW ~~~~~~~ Enabling a trivial Swift on Ceph Storage via RadosGW can be done in a few steps with the help of the `cephadm guides <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/cephadm/services/rgw/>`. .. code-block:: console sudo ceph orch apply rgw foo --port=7480 sudo ceph orch apply mgr << HOSTNAME >> After a few moments your rgw clients should be created. You can find them by searching for client.rgw and finding clients such as: client.rgw.<hostname>.abcdef .. code-block:: console sudo ceph auth ls | grep client.rgw At this point you will need to apply your `ceph configurations <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/keystone/#integrating-with-openstack-keystone>` to each of your clients found above and `client.rgw.default`. These configurations will allow you to use keystone as a backend and instantiate basic settings. Once complete, restart rgw hosts to apply the settings. .. code-block:: console $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_api_version 3 $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_url https://<$internal_url>:35357 $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_accepted_admin_roles "admin, ResellerAdmin" $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_accepted_roles "_member_, member, admin, ResellerAdmin" $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_implicit_tenants true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_user ceph_rgw $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_password <ceph_rgw_pass from the passwords.yml> $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_project service $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_domain default $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_verify_ssl false # Useful for self-signed certificates $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_content_length_compat true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_enable_apis "s3, swift, swift_auth, admin" $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_enforce_swift_acls true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_swift_account_in_url true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_swift_versioning_enabled true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_verify_ssl false $ sudo ceph orch restart rgw.foo Enable the following swift options in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml`` and enter all of your rgw hosts as well: .. code-block:: yaml enable_ceph_rgw: true enable_swift: "no" # Feature for swift on disk, not through ceph. enable_swift_s3api: "yes" enable_ceph_rgw_keystone: true ceph_rgw_swift_compatibility: true ceph_rgw_swift_account_in_url: true enable_ceph_rgw_loadbalancer: true ceph_rgw_hosts: - host: < HOST 0 HOSTNAME > ip: < HOST 0 HOSTNAME IP > port: 7480 - host: < HOST 1 HOSTNAME > ip: < HOST 1 HOSTNAME IP > port: 7480 Once deploy is complete, verify that your endpoints are created successfully and have the correct endpoint address. https://< FQDN or IP >:6780/swift/v1/AUTH_%(project_id)s

subject: update cert-manager to 1.8.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-13 16:07:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/3b99ea90c67474f4ee3cc4fd620532daa26d3dee', 'message': 'update cert-manager to 1.8.0

[1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh` to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

commit_message:
update cert-manager to 1.8.0

[1] changed `deploy-k8s.sh` to use Kubernetes 1.23 instead of 1.19.

This broke cert-manager as ca-injector had an error of:

Error: error registering secret controller: no matches for kind
"MutatingWebhookConfiguration" in version
"admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1"

This is because admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 no longer exists
in Kubernetes 1.23.

Upgrade cert-manager so it uses admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1 instead.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/+/840691

Change-Id: I13722754cccfc410b2c4c2948b8a729a2df824d9

commit_message:
trivial: fix deprecation warning in notification fixture

This change simply replaces calling notifyAll() with
notify_all() on the threading condition object in
the notification fixture.

notify_all() was introduced in python 2.6

Change-Id: If8d386f20693016dd35ecfdbc703bf31aa103a67

commit_message:
Revert "Block neutron-lib 2.21.0"

This reverts commit 5a8e4c5122389d010b74d0d8c84336b3ceb142ed.

Reason for revert:
The error found in LP#1973162 and LP#1942190 seems to be in the Neutron
L3 code. There is a race condition when two routers try to update a HA
port. With [1][2], this is more evident as we protect the DB transactions
and Neutron always creates two active port bindings for the same port.

[3] is addressing this problem. I'm reverting this patch to test [3]
with neutron-lib 2.21.0

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/828738
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/833247
[3]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/841712

Change-Id: I099703bb72291afa9cb7a5130b823334303528d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/89/841489/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow logging of Content-Type text/plain

Noticed this while doing some local testing, if a WSGI app replies with
a text/plain content type to communicate a server error, we aren't able
to see the error response message when passing --debug to the
openstackclient, example:

  RESP: [500] Date: Thu, 01 Oct 2020 23:54:15 GMT Server: Apache/2.4.18
  (Ubuntu) Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 Connection: close
  Transfer-Encoding: chunked
  RESP BODY: Omitted, Content-Type is set to text/plain; charset=UTF-8.
  Only application/json responses have their bodies logged.

Change-Id: Ibfd46c7725bd0aa26f1f80b0e8fc6eda2ac2e090

commit_message:
Fix version discovery check of url for integer project id

Check if the last url segment matches the project id.
Previously the check only confirmed whether the last url segment
endswith the project id which could cause problems with spurious
matches of some legacy integer project ids.

Closes-Bug: 1968793
Change-Id: I7c6c22e41bde2a73508635b7e964c58a02c12146
