commit_message:
Add pre-network and network phase and playbooks

Add playbooks for the pre-network and network phases of a deployment.
The network playbook uses the tripleo_network_config role to apply the
os-net-config configuration.

Change-Id: Ia74677e32796426caf8a7067f57375a8c959bdfa
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/03/840903/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2022 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. - hosts: "primary_role_name:deploy_target_host" strategy: tripleo_free name: Deploy TripleO Network gather_facts: "{{ gather_facts | default(false) }}" any_errors_fatal: true tasks: - name: Run Network Config import_role: name: tripleo_network_config vars: tripleo_network_config_with_ansible: true

commit_message:
Add standalone bootstrap phase and playbook

Adds a bootstrap phase to the standalone playbooks. The initial set of
tasks are copied from tripleo-heat-templates.

Needed-By: I0e2a00e54f23c96bef8b92f571b482362028a701
Change-Id: Ie36cc178c7b41a1f8988f3ab5968bc310f6f5455
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/77/840677/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2022 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. - hosts: "{{ primary_role_name | default([]) }}:{{ deploy_target_host | default([]) }}" strategy: tripleo_free gather_facts: "{{ gather_facts | default(false) }}" any_errors_fatal: true become: true tasks: - name: Ensure /var/log/journal exists become: true file: path=/var/log/journal state=directory mode=0750 owner=root group=root setype=var_log_t - name: Check cloud-init status shell: systemctl is-active cloud-init.service || systemctl is-enabled cloud-init.service failed_when: false become: true register: cloud_init_enabled - name: Check if cloud-init is disabled via kernel args shell: cat /proc/cmdline | grep -q cloud-init=disabled failed_when: false check_mode: false register: cloud_init_vendor_disabled - name: Wait for cloud-init to finish, if enabled community.general.cloud_init_data_facts: filter: status register: res until: > res.cloud_init_data_facts.status.v1.stage is defined and not res.cloud_init_data_facts.status.v1.stage retries: 50 delay: 5 when: - cloud_init_enabled.rc is defined - cloud_init_enabled.rc == 0 - cloud_init_vendor_disabled.rc is not defined or cloud_init_vendor_disabled.rc != 0

subject: Ensure requirements SHA variable is included for healthcheck playbook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 14:02:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/af61fe027d15811d26d535da56f31f5ef14f42a3', 'message': "Ensure requirements SHA variable is included for healthcheck playbook

Also add a zuul job which runs when the heathcheck playbook is changed

commit_message:
Ensure requirements SHA variable is included for healthcheck playbook

Also add a zuul job which runs when the heathcheck playbook is changed
so that we don't merge an error like this again.

Change-Id: Iab0ea6de155c020deb9ed71253b5b8854c6da562

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 13:49:00.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/cephfs/test_driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1971530-fix-cephfs-native-deny-access-facf37fa7053c30d.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/a607ed8e999209f8a369f05191a0490ca426f4d6', 'message': "[Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules

In rare scenarios, an access rule known to manila may
be missing from CephFS. The driver shouldn't raise an
exception when this happens.

Change-Id: Iaeb84f1d9f4c04c23f470ad777d7d6cf2455f543
Closes-Bug: #1971530
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74e1fe4761b3bc4efb9a60d1b2887766c9ce43a9)
"}]
commit_message:
[Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules

In rare scenarios, an access rule known to manila may
be missing from CephFS. The driver shouldn't raise an
exception when this happens.

Change-Id: Iaeb84f1d9f4c04c23f470ad777d7d6cf2455f543
Closes-Bug: #1971530
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74e1fe4761b3bc4efb9a60d1b2887766c9ce43a9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/79/841479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The CephFS driver no longer fails to delete access rules that were never applied or were missing from the back end storage. See `LP #1971530 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1971530>`_ for more details.

commit_message:
Remove create_timestamp & get_timestamp methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest 27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Replaced methods:
	* create_timestamp
	* get_timestamp

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: Ib07791ed0ee2bbf9124e9852e254d384e55c4be1

subject: Wait for OVN dbs also along with sockets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-06 12:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/1baa8905d5a3d677b5298e76621b9e08e0ed0f13', 'message': "Wait for OVN dbs also along with sockets

When OVN is setup from distro packages, the
main service is ovn-central which when restarted,
restarts ovn-northd, ovn nb and db services.

And during the restart ovn dbs(ovnnb_db.db and ovnsb_db.db)
are created, which may sometime takes time as seen with
ubuntu jammy tests[1].

We already checking for socket's file to be available,
let's also check for db files as without it ovn-*ctl
operations succeed but changes are not persisted until
db files are available and changes are lost with the restart.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/839389

Change-Id: I178da7af8cba8bcc8a67174e439df7c0f2c7d4d5
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for OVN dbs also along with sockets

When OVN is setup from distro packages, the
main service is ovn-central which when restarted,
restarts ovn-northd, ovn nb and db services.

And during the restart ovn dbs(ovnnb_db.db and ovnsb_db.db)
are created, which may sometime takes time as seen with
ubuntu jammy tests[1].

We already checking for socket's file to be available,
let's also check for db files as without it ovn-*ctl
operations succeed but changes are not persisted until
db files are available and changes are lost with the restart.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/839389

Change-Id: I178da7af8cba8bcc8a67174e439df7c0f2c7d4d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/85/840885/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function wait_for_db_file { local count=0 while [ ! -f $1 ]; do sleep 1 count=$((count+1)) if [ "$count" -gt 5 ]; then die $LINENO "DB File $1 not found" fi done } # Check for socket and db files for both OVN NB and SB wait_for_db_file $OVN_DATADIR/ovnnb_db.db wait_for_db_file $OVN_DATADIR/ovnsb_db.db

commit_message:
Stop double compressing pdns logs

This patch changes the powerDNS log collection to stop double compressing the log archive. The designate role compressed the log file and the zuul role also compresses the file.
This will allow the powerDNS logs to be directly viewable via the zuul logs page.

Change-Id: Ic86b8637e00525037b1c7735f9909d83397593a2

deleted_lines: journalctl -o short-precise --unit pdns | gzip - > {{ stage_dir }}/logs/pdns.txt.gz

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle teting runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Add release notes and update the python
classifier for the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I68fded0366a3be3ef5459391982e80c570562735

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: Iddb575ef94f8162f8d07f650db4611a5fd07b258

commit_message:
CI: Add Neutron to required-projects list

Unit tests jobs (openstack-tox-py3x) are better to run with latest
Neutron otherwise they can fail till a new Neutron release is out.

Change-Id: I83cb8ca8969567f0383f6842ccf66e1864e0a715

commit_message:
RBD: Don't flatten temporary resources

There are instances where cinder needs to create a temporary volume and
this can trigger a flatten of the new temporary volume, which will make
the operation take a lot longer.

In some cases this means slower operations, but in others it leads to
rpc timeout failures.

A case where we see timeout failures is when doing a backup of a
snapshot and we have rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot=true.

This patch ensures that we don't flatten temporary volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1916843
Change-Id: I8f55c3beb2f8df5b2227506f82ddf6ee57c951ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/92/790492/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | RBD driver `bug #1916843 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1916843>`_: Fixed rpc timeout when backing up RBD snapshot. We no longer flatten temporary volumes and snapshots.

commit_message:
Update python testing classifier

Yoga testing runtime[1] has been updated to add py39
testing as voting. Unit tests update are handled by the
job template change in openstack-zuul-job

- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/820286

this commit updates the classifier in setup.cfg file.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/yoga.html

commit_message:
Support specify project id by annotation

The implementation have some difference with the description of
blueprint. For more strict isolation, we only get project id from
namespace annotaion or configure option. The other resources's
project id inherit it's project or get from configiure option.

Implements: blueprint specify-project-by-annotation
Change-Id: Ia82cce6b211226599b4e1ca0d10416ed5e519ea2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/68/832768/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2022 Troila # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from kuryr.lib._i18n import _ from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from kuryr_kubernetes import constants from kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers import base from kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers import utils as driver_utils from kuryr_kubernetes import exceptions as k_exc CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) annotation_project_driver_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt( "annotation_key", default="openstack.org/kuryr-project-id", help=_("The key of annotation which used to specify the " "project id of openstack.")) ] CONF.register_opts(annotation_project_driver_opts, "annotation_project") class AnnotationProjectBaseDriver(base.PodProjectDriver): """Provides project ID for Pod based on resource's annotation.""" annotation_key = CONF.annotation_project.annotation_key def get_project(self, resource): # Firstly, we try to get project id from annotations of the resource # directly; Then we try to get project id from the annotations of # the resource's namespace; At last, we try to get project id from # configuration option. project_id = None res_md = resource['metadata'] if (res_md.get('annotations') and res_md['annotations'].get(self.annotation_key)): project_id = res_md['annotations'][self.annotation_key] else: pod_ns = res_md['namespace'] namespace_path = '{}/{}'.format( constants.K8S_API_NAMESPACES, pod_ns) namespace = driver_utils.get_k8s_resource(namespace_path) ns_md = namespace['metadata'] if (ns_md.get('annotations') and ns_md['annotations'].get(self.annotation_key)): project_id = ns_md['annotations'][self.annotation_key] else: project_id = CONF.neutron_defaults.project if not project_id: raise k_exc.LackProjectId(resource) return project_id class AnnotationPodProjectDriver(AnnotationProjectBaseDriver): def get_project(self, pod): return super().get_project(pod) class AnnotationServiceProjectDriver(AnnotationProjectBaseDriver): def get_project(self, service): return super().get_project(service) class AnnotationNamespaceProjectDriver(base.PodProjectDriver): annotation_key = CONF.annotation_project.annotation_key def get_project(self, namespace): ns_md = namespace['metadata'] if (ns_md.get('annotations') and ns_md['annotations'].get(self.annotation_key)): project_id = ns_md['annotations'][self.annotation_key] else: project_id = CONF.neutron_defaults.project if not project_id: raise k_exc.LackProjectId(namespace) return project_id class AnnotationNetworkPolicyProjectDriver(AnnotationProjectBaseDriver): def get_project(self, network_policy): return super().get_project(network_policy)

commit_message:
Drop python3.6/3.7 support in testing runtime

In Zed cycle testing runtime, we are targetting to drop the
python 3.6/3.7 support, project started adding python 3.8 as minimum,

example nova:
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/56b5aed08c6a3ed81b78dc216f0165ebfe3c3350/setup.cfg#L13

Also indicates that we support python 3.9.

Change-Id: I9f9e63fcea02a90a08bfb381755ed76cdd35ddef

commit_message:
Add share access rules to shared file system

Introduce Share Access Rules class with
basic methods including list, and get to
shared file system storage service

Change-Id: I120212e6f1a01644479dc9bc4547b022049c49a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/81/803081/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack import resource class ShareAccessRules(resource.Resource): resource_key = "access" resources_key = "access_list" base_path = "/share-access-rules" # capabilities allow_create = False allow_fetch = True allow_commit = False allow_delete = False allow_list = True allow_head = False #: Properties share_id = resource.URI("share_id", type=str) #: The access credential of the entity granted share access. access_key = resource.Body("access_key", type=str) #: The access level to the share. To grant or deny access to a share, #: you specify one of the following share access levels: ro, rw. access_level = resource.Body("access_level", type=str) #: The object of the access rule. To list access rules, set this value #: to null. access_list = resource.Body("access_list", type=str) #:The value that defines the access. The back end grants or denies the #: access to it. A valid value is one of these values: ip, cert, user. access_to = resource.Body("access_to", type=str) #: The access rule type. A valid value for the share access rule type #: is one of the following values: ip, cert, user. access_type = resource.Body("access_type", type=str) #: The date and time stamp when the resource was created within the #: services database. created_at = resource.Body("created_at", type=str) #: The access rule ID. id = resource.Body("id", type=str) #: One or more access rule metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary #: of strings. metadata = resource.Body("metadata", type=dict) #: The date and time stamp when the resource was last updated within #: the services database. If a resource was never updated after it was #: created, the value of this parameter is set to null. updated_at = resource.Body("updated_at", type=str)

commit_message:
Fix the crd_lb_ip not being defined.

During execution it may happen, that there will be UnboundLocalError
exception thrown for crd_lb_ip variable, due to unmet condition for
service ip not being set in the KuryrLoadbalancerCRD. Fixed by simply
defining variable.

Change-Id: Ie879ba0b9b85111ec1b906d66ec48127ce8dd1f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin refs/changes/17/841217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: crd_lb_ip = None

commit_message:
Split venv_rebuild functionality

This patch aims to split functionality of ``venv_rebuild`` into 2
separate parts - rebuilding venv and rebuilding wheels. That will give
more control over what needs to be done.

Change-Id: Ie14f12c6756cd1f866b660acc8fd6aa5695f6c33
Related-Bug: #1914301
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build refs/changes/84/773984/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Set context for unbound.log on selinux systems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-12 05:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/89-boot-settings'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/4be8c66630b4a58b0dff9f0c7cd307404e65530d', 'message': "Set context for unbound.log on selinux systems

I4f3265c16320613d4ba74a02df1361c5d9cf2fb1 moved this file to
/var/lib/unbound on selinux systems, as it was getting permissions
errors trying to write into /var/log.

This turns out to make it harder to collect the logs from projects
like devstack.  It's simpler if we just have the log file in a
consistent place.  On selinux systems, set the context, and revert
things to just writing into /usr/log/unbound.log

Change-Id: I6bb58ef0d6bf4cbbb7fd4066e01b7a01d05009c3
"}]
commit_message:
Set context for unbound.log on selinux systems

I4f3265c16320613d4ba74a02df1361c5d9cf2fb1 moved this file to
/var/lib/unbound on selinux systems, as it was getting permissions
errors trying to write into /var/log.

This turns out to make it harder to collect the logs from projects
like devstack.  It's simpler if we just have the log file in a
consistent place.  On selinux systems, set the context, and revert
things to just writing into /usr/log/unbound.log

Change-Id: I6bb58ef0d6bf4cbbb7fd4066e01b7a01d05009c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/841546/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: logfile: \"/var/log/unbound.log\"# NOTE(ianw) 2022-05-22 : not 100% sure why but emperically unbound # runs under named context. Generally it doesn't log here on rhel-ish # distros, but for consistency it's much easier if we just have one # log file in the same place across distros. Thus set the context to # allow it. if [[ -e /usr/bin/chcon ]]; then chcon -t named_log_t /var/log/unbound.log fi
deleted_lines: if [[ "$DISTRO_NAME" =~ (centos|rhel7|fedora|openeuler|rocky) ]] ; then LOG_FILE="/var/lib/unbound/unbound.log" else LOG_FILE="/var/log/unbound.log" fi logfile: \"$LOG_FILE\"

commit_message:
Set py_modules to empty list in setup.py

This prevents setuptools 61.0.0 doing autodiscovery and failing
as this is an ansible role, not a python module.

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Id0b18670847a78c55295c74a7070b580d90ffed0
(cherry picked from commit 5126770a6cf8643d678427aab8ea75bbb367e496)

commit_message:
Reparent Projects

Change-Id: Icad02da278191ab6b5885f2d427e435d512790cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/44/618144/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================= Reparent Projects ================= `bp example <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/reparent-projects>`_ Add flag to keystone-manage to move a set of projects from one parent project to another. Problem Description =================== Many clpoud users start off with a flat project structure. As the number of projects increase, they realize they need to better organizat their projects. WHen they Move from a flat structure to a hierarchical structure, they want don't want to tear down and recreate the set of resources in remote services. Proposed Change =============== Provide a subcomand to keystone manage that allows the reparenting of a project. `keystone-manage reparent --project <project_id> --parent <new_parent_poroject_id>` When executed, this command will reset the parent_project_id of the project. This command will only complete if the project is disabled. Alternatives ------------ Hack the SQL database Security Impact --------------- Big. This is in keystone manage to avoid the security issues of doing as an API. This should not be done lightly. Notifications Impact -------------------- Please specify any changes to notifications. Be that an extra notification, changes to an existing notification, or removing a notification. Other End User Impact --------------------- Aside from the API, are there other ways a user will interact with this feature? * Does this change have an impact on python-keystoneclient? What does the user interface there look like? Performance Impact ------------------ Describe any potential performance impact on the system, for example how often will new code be called, and is there a major change to the calling pattern of existing code. Examples of things to consider here include: * A small change in a utility function or a commonly used decorator can have a large impacts on performance. * Calls which result in a database queries can have a profound impact on performance when called in critical sections of the code. * Will the change include any locking, and if so what considerations are there on holding the lock? Other Deployer Impact --------------------- Discuss things that will affect how you deploy and configure OpenStack that have not already been mentioned, such as: * What config options are being added? Should they be more generic than proposed (for example a flag that other hypervisor drivers might want to implement as well)? Are the default values ones which will work well in real deployments? * Is this a change that takes immediate effect after its merged, or is it something that has to be explicitly enabled? * If this change is a new binary, how would it be deployed? * Please state anything that those doing continuous deployment, or those upgrading from the previous release, need to be aware of. Also describe any plans to deprecate configuration values or features. For example, if we change the directory name that instances are stored in, how do we handle instance directories created before the change landed? Do we move them? Do we have a special case in the code? Do we assume that the operator will recreate all the instances in their cloud? Developer Impact ---------------- Discuss things that will affect other developers working on OpenStack, such as: * If the blueprint proposes a change to the driver API, discussion of how other backends would implement the feature is required. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: Adrian Turjak <adriant> Other contributors: Adam Young Morgan Fainberg Work Items ---------- Work items or tasks -- break the feature up into the things that need to be done to implement it. Those parts might end up being done by different people, but we're mostly trying to understand the timeline for implementation. Dependencies ============ * Include specific references to specs and/or blueprints in keystone, or in other projects, that this one either depends on or is related to. * If this requires functionality of another project that is not currently used by Keystone (such as the glance v2 API when we previously only required v1), document that fact. * Does this feature require any new library dependencies or code otherwise not included in OpenStack? Or does it depend on a specific version of library? Documentation Impact ==================== What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. References ========== Please add any useful references here. You are not required to have any reference. Moreover, this specification should still make sense when your references are unavailable. Examples of what you could include are: * Links to mailing list or IRC discussions * Links to notes from a summit session * Links to relevant research, if appropriate * Related specifications as appropriate (e.g. if it's an EC2 thing, link the EC2 docs) * Anything else you feel it is worthwhile to refer to

commit_message:
Replace mirantis mirror with ceph download links

All of the ceph images we define here use mirantis mirrors instead
of pulling from ceph directly. This change updates each image
to pull directly from download.ceph.com instead.

Change-Id: Ifdc92af9c8415ca29f4c288d8a2f84c588d27f65

commit_message:
Avoid failing if no pools/keys are specified

This patch adds a check on the variables generated by deployed ceph.
If one of those variables is skipped in tripleoclient, we need to
make sure the content of the if statement is not created.

Change-Id: Ic52ee6091ebab6f937a4a15c83a28f0b3918d374
(cherry picked from commit 7d32bad0ae70e6daed82f19cd1b1e1c4cf8ff930)

commit_message:
Add extra debug log with current and new port statuses in ML2 plugin

This patch only adds one extra debug log to log current and new
port statuses in the method which updates that status in the DB.
This may be useful e.g. to understand why notifications about port
change aren't send to Nova in some cases (like unshelve instance, see
related bug).

Related-Bug: #1953478
Change-Id: I4c6fd5b0b33bf764c0b182f169173453ea7a4efc
(cherry picked from commit 34e560fad0b773d4b81032f876994d5340195600)

commit_message:
Collect unbound.log from alternate location

Due to selinux issues, on nodepool images with selinux, the path to the unbound log file is under /var/lib/unbound instead of /var/log [1].

This patch adds the /var/lib/unbound/unbound.log location to the list of log files that devstack-base jobs will collect.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/506332

Change-Id: I38c5fda918d7f3b0361389d36c8d945d8fc32ef6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/60/841460/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Due to selinux issues, nodepool sets the unbound log under # /var/lib/unbound /var/lib/unbound/unbound.log: logs

subject: Image Caching Enhancements for Edge Cloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-22 20:25:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/217c6aed270db91b4abdf78c115966f25b7a21a1', 'message': 'Image Caching Enhancements for Edge Cloud
In a distributed edge cloud environment, with a central cloud and
multiple geographically-distributed edge clouds, the OpenStack Edge-Computing
Group has defined a "pull & cache"-type architecture for image management
within its Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Edge Architecture.  In support of
this architecture, Glance will be enhanced such that, on edge clouds, Glance
can be configured to interwork with a remote Glance API and its storage
backends (at central cloud), in order to fetch and cache image and image
meta data managed by the central cloud.

Change-Id: Iae28b87f38214d5b84cef81d5b42a0aa9265dcbb
Signed-off-by: Greg Waines <greg.waines@windriver.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-11-28 20:15:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/54f47b22bc4bfc0b58aa846c712245c8f7021a84', 'message': 'Image Caching Enhancements for Edge Cloud
In a distributed edge cloud environment, with a central cloud and
multiple geographically-distributed edge clouds, the OpenStack Edge-Computing
Group has defined a "pull & cache"-type architecture for image management
within its Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Edge Architecture.  In support of
this architecture, Glance will be enhanced such that, on edge clouds, Glance
can be configured to interwork with a remote Glance API and its storage
backends (at central cloud), in order to fetch and cache image and image
meta data managed by the central cloud.

commit_message:
Image Caching Enhancements for Edge Cloud

In a distributed edge cloud environment, with a central cloud and
multiple geographically-distributed edge clouds, the OpenStack Edge-Computing
Group has defined a "pull & cache"-type architecture for image management
within its Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Edge Architecture.  In support of
this architecture, Glance will be enhanced such that, on edge clouds, Glance
can be configured to interwork with a remote Glance API and its storage
backends (at central cloud), in order to fetch and cache image and image
meta data managed by the central cloud.

Change-Id: Iae28b87f38214d5b84cef81d5b42a0aa9265dcbb
Signed-off-by: Greg Waines <greg.waines@windriver.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/38/619638/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. Many thanks to the OpenStack Nova team for the Example Spec that formed the basis for this document. ================================================== Glance - Image Caching Enhancements for Edge Cloud ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/glance-caching-for-edge In a distributed edge cloud environment, with a central cloud and multiple geographically-distributed edge clouds, the OpenStack Edge-Computing Group has defined a "pull & cache"-type architecture for image management within its Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Edge Architecture. In support of this architecture, Glance will be enhanced such that, on edge clouds, Glance can be configured to interwork with a remote Glance API and its storage backends (at central cloud), in order to fetch and cache image and image meta data managed by the central cloud. Problem description =================== In a distributed edge cloud environment, with 100s or 1000s of edge cloud sites, the centralized orchestration of cloud services across all the edge cloud sites is imperative for operational usability. This specification deals specifically with the centralized orchestration of the image service across the central cloud and all edge cloud sites. For the image service, in a distributed edge cloud environment, it is desired for users to be able to manage images (i.e. add/modify/delete) at a single point (the central cloud), and use images (i.e. nova boot, create volumes) anywhere (at any of the edge clouds). It is also required to avoid the latency in transferring images between the central cloud and the edge clouds as much as possible. Due to limited resources on edge clouds, it is also desirable to minimize the resources used on each edge cloud; i.e. avoid transferring images to an edge cloud if the image is not required at that edge cloud. And finally, the edge cloud's image service should be autonomous, in the case of connection loss to the central cloud; i.e. any images already transferred to the edge cloud should still be available for local use. Existing multi-cloud solutions such as edge clouds sharing the central cloud's Image Service in a multi-region type environment, or edge cloud's image service supporting multiple remote backends, does not meet these requirements. Proposed change =============== In support of edge-computing architectures, with a central cloud and multiple geographically-distributed edge clouds, the OpenStack Edge-Computing Group has defined a "pull & cache"-type architecture for image management, where: * Glance images are managed (created / meta-data modified / deleted) from a single point; the central cloud, * The central cloud having a standard Glance deployment; * i.e. a Glance API managing the Image Records DB and one or more Glance storage backends. * The edge clouds would have a Glance deployment enhanced by this spec to support a Glance API that: * manages a local image records DB and one or more local Glance storage backends, * i.e. for support of edge cloud specific image management, if required, * AND * can also be configured to interwork with a remote Glance API and its remote Glance storage backends (at central cloud), in order to fetch image and image meta data managed at the central cloud, * NOTE all messaging with remote Glance API will be via existing Glance REST APIs, * with support for Glance caching when fetching these remote images, and * with Glance caching enhanced by this spec to additionally cache image metadata in order to support autonomous use of cached images (i.e. nova boot, etc) when connectivity is lost to the remote Glance API at central cloud. * effectively entire glance image object will be cached; e.g. min_disk, min_ram, all metadata, all image member data, etc. . Other Key Behaviours -------------------- * The edge cloud Glance API will ONLY have read access to images and image metadata on the remote Glance at central cloud; * The edge cloud Glance API will have full read/write/modify access to images and image metadata in the local image record DB and local storage backends, * locally created images and metadata on the edge clouds will NOT be synchronized up to the central cloud, * When requesting an image list from the edge cloud's Glance API, a merged list of images in the local edge cloud's Glance and images in the remote central cloud's Glance will be returned, * When requesting an image and/or image metadata from the edge cloud's Glance API, * the local image records DB / storage backends will be checked first, * if the image is not found, the local Glance cache will be checked next, * if the image is still not found, the request will be passed on to the remote Glance at the central cloud. * If Glance caching is enabled at the edge cloud Glance, when the edge cloud Glance API requests an image from the remote Glance on central cloud: * the edge cloud Glance API will cache the downloaded image and its image metadata in the local Glance cache, * all subsequent edge cloud Glance API requests for this (immutable) image will retrieve the image from the local Glance cache, * however 'all' edge cloud Glance API requests for this image will result in re-downloading the (mutable) image metadata from the remote Glance on the central cloud, if connectivity is present; otherwise the cached version of the image metadata will be used. * The edge cloud Glance API will NOT be allowed to locally independently modify images or image meta data cached from the central cloud, * The local edge cloud Glance must be autonomous in case network connectivity is lost to the remote central cloud Glance; images and associated image metadata already cached should still be available and support local nova boots or volume creates. NOTE Only one configured remote Glance API will be supported at a local edge cloud Glance. NOTE There will be no attempt to resolve conflicting Image UUIDs between images created on central cloud and images created locally on edge clouds. Current thinking is that unique naming conventions and support for 'name or id' image searches for all APIs are a workaround for conflicting Image UUIDs when they occur. Detailed Work Items ------------------- * Add/Update parameters to the Glance config file to enable this behaviour and define connectivity to remote Glance server, * Updated Configuration Parameters: * 'data_api' requires a new option(s) to indicate this new 'data access' solution where image data is retrieved from both a local db and a remote Glance server, * however, 'data_api' is deprecated, * alternative approach would be to use the 'flavor' configuration parameter where this new 'data access' solution is defined as another pipeline option. * I.e. Similar to the way the cache and cache management are defined as another pipeline option by setting flavor=keystone+cachemanagement. * New Configuration Parameters: e.g. * remote_glance_server_keystone_url * i.e. to retrieve remote glance server public endpoint from, * remote_glance_server_username * remote_glance_server_password * Implement the new data_api or flavor pipeline solution to retrieve and cache image and image metadata from a remote Glance server if image not found in local db * Retrieve image and all image metadata from remote server, if image not found in local db, * When caching an image, get that image's metadata and merge it into the local database; note that processing and transforming certain fields (especially location) of that metadata may be required, * Allow creation / deletion of local images and image metadata, * Implement a driver to allow a Glance API server to download an image from another Glance API server, * Only support downloading images as creating images will only be done locally. Alternatives ============ An alternative solution considered for Image Management in a distributed edge cloud environment, with a central cloud and multiple geographically-distributed edge clouds, was to proactively push / synchronize images and image metadata from the central cloud to the edge clouds. This has the advantage over the reactive pull approach that the initial use of an image would NOT incur the latency of retrieving the image from the central cloud. However it has the disadvantage, in the default scenario of pushing all images to all edge clouds, of being wasteful of resources on the edge cloud Sites holding images that may never be used. Data model impact ================= There are no DB Model changes required to any Services. REST API impact =============== There are no REST API changes required to any Services. Security impact =============== The central cloud Glance server's credentials are required in the local edge cloud's Glance .conf file. As always, OpenStack services' .conf files should be properly protected through appropriately permissioned directories and files. Other end user impact ===================== With a remote Glance server configured for the local Glance, the end user will be able to access both local images and the remote images at the remote Glance server. Performance Impact ================== Accessing of an image in a configured remote Glance server, will incur a latency due to downloading the image from the remote Glance server. If local Glance caching is enabled, then all subsequent image accesses will fetch the image from the cache, and NOT incur this latency. Other deployer impact ===================== There are no deployer impacts with this work. Developer impact ================= There are no developer impacts with this work. Upgrade impact =============== It is assumed that software upgrades in a distributed environment will upgrade the central cloud first and edge clouds second. This way the central cloud running N+1 version of Glance, will be backwards compatible to edge clouds still running N version of Glance. Also given that the edge cloud Glance is using the normal HTTP REST API to message the remote Glance at the central cloud, then the usual backwards-compatibility behaviour would apply. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: Stefan Dinescu Other contributors: None Repos Impacted ============== * glance Work Items =========== * Add/Update parameters to the Glance config file, * Implement a driver to allow a Glance API server to download an image from another Glance API server, * Implement the new data_api or flavor pipeline solution to retrieve and cache image and image metadata from a remote Glance server, * Testing, * Documentation update. * Add a Release Note for Stein. Dependencies ============ There are no external dependencies for this work. Testing ======= * Configure a Glance API server to use another server as a remote source, * glance image-list should provide the merged list of images in the remote server and any locally created images, * After creating a volume or an instance based on an image in the remote server, check with glance-caching commands that the image and its metadata was properly cached, * Locally create an image, * Create volumes and instances from local, cached and not-yet-cached images * Disconnect/shutoff the remote server and create volumes and instances from local and cached images. * Create volumes and instances with caching not-enabled in order to ensure that non-cached operation of glance is not impacted. * Configure a Glance API server that does NOT use another server as a remote source and verify standard Glance operations with and without caching. * Unit tests will be added to cover the new Glance functionality. Documentation Impact ==================== The Glance administrator guide should be updated to describe this new functionality to access and cache the images and image metadata of a remote Glance server. Configuration file changes should be documented as well. References ========== None. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Stein - Introduced

commit_message:
Use asynchronous writes for ceph RBD

This bp proposes a change to use aio_write
for image upload process.

Change-Id: Icb3263991b365b523c4b4f97a078a2a84658b00b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/18/744818/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Make RBD Image Upload Asynchronous ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance-store/+spec/upload-rbd-image-asynchronously Ceph RBD supports writing to backend asynchronously, meaning that there could be multiple writing issued on the fly. By allowing concurrent write, it could potentially better take advantage of power of ceph as a distributed datastore. Problem description =================== Uploading to ceph RBD backend is pretty slow in case ceph cluster does not have high end storage backends. In our PRD environment, speeds of uploading to rbd normally only has an upperbound around 40-60 MB/s. Since most of the time, ceph public network is at least 10G, this means we could still optimize upload process. Proposed change =============== Replacing `write` with `aio_write` which allows writing to backend asynchronously. Ceph python library exposes `aio_write` method to allow concurrent writes. This function takes the following parameters * data: data to be saved * offset: the offset to start writing at * oncomplete: a callback function triggered when write completes * fadvise_flags: fadvise flags for this write The `oncomplete` function takes a single argument `complete`. A successful write will yield 0 after calling `get_return_value` on the object. A new option `rbd_max_concurrent_write` is added to control max number of concurrent writes on the fly. And if this upperbound is met, next write will be blocked until one of previous executions complete. Checksum calculation will be computed immediately after aio_write is issued, and an error will be raised if any write failed. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Other deployer impact --------------------- Addition of a new ``rbd_max_concurrent_write`` configuration option for rbd and filesystem store will require operator to enable it. Without this option, behaviour will stay the same as before. As this configuration option is per store, it is possible in a multi-store environment to choose on which store it will be enabled. Developer impact ---------------- None, as these optimizations are handled inside drivers itself and should not change their interfaces. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ushen Work Items ---------- * Update drivers who can handle sparse images: filesystem and rbd. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Testing that there is no functional regression for the modified drivers. Documentation Impact ==================== * Document the new configuration option ``rbd_max_concurrent_write`` for rbd. References ========== Ceph aio write documentation: https://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/api/python/

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/18/763318/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Add chunk download support for rbd backend spec lite ==================================================== :project: glance_store :problem: Rbd support random reading, and the rbd driver is designed to support partial download. But the current version disables this feature, and didn't implement the chunk support. :solution: To implement this feature, we propose to add complete the ImageIterator part of rbd driver adding chunk download support and enable rbd.Store's random reading capability. Then users can download am image partially using image download API with Rang property in header from glance whose backend is rbd. :impacts: None :how: Pass offset and chunk_size to ImageIterator in of rbd driver, which will determine whether the request is a partial get. When the request is partial, the data size returned will be chunk size. :alternatives: None :timeline: Pre-implementation has been completed. :link: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763114/ :reviewers: Abhishek Kekane :assignee: Jinsheng Zhang

Add spec-lite "ignore-checksum-option-image-download"

Change-Id: I9ae9e65afff8bf05dbf1a22e9816a5dc09cfa1e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/53/817353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================= Spec Lite: add option "--igonre-checksum" for image-download ========================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/igonre-checksum-option-image-download :project: python-glanceclient :problem: When uploading image with VMware vSphere backend, the image will convert to VM template as an image. In this case, glance image-download operation will export the VM template to a vmdk image file. The VM export operation will do some format convert, so the hash and checksum values are always different for every image download operation. VMware vSphere backend also support uploading image with non-template images, and the checksum compare does not have issue in this case, however considering the nova instance launch performance, template images are default setting. :solution: Because the VM template export image with non-unique checksum, it is hard to record the correct checksum info in glance DB, considering to add option "--ignore-checksum" in glance client :impacts: DocImpact :how: Add an option "--ignore-checksum" and let users to ignore the checksum compare when can not be guaranteed to be same :alternatives: None :timeline: :link: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-glanceclient/+/817203 :reviewers: :assignee:

commit_message:
Fix headings in the API ref

openstackdocstheme's custom styling doesn't display (h1)
headings in the body of the API ref. To work-around this
problem, demote the section headers and increase
the display level of the toctree.

Change-Id: I18b6ab44b62c4f17d854e5d32b4aef546992c79a
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules

In rare scenarios, an access rule known to manila may
be missing from CephFS. The driver shouldn't raise an
exception when this happens.

Change-Id: Iaeb84f1d9f4c04c23f470ad777d7d6cf2455f543
Closes-Bug: #1971530
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/30/840430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | The CephFS driver no longer fails to delete access rules that were never applied or were missing from the back end storage. See `LP #1971530 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1971530>`_ for more details.

commit_message:
Some tweaks to improve work with Material Theme

Material Theme css tags differ from the ones from Default Theme,
so the navigation we have doesn't work for some actions such as
opening a new details page or reloading it, displaying breadcrumbs
and menu panels. This patch adds some tweaks to fix that.

Closes-Bug: #1968272

Change-Id: I18bd2e8515614463a911978879523744a9b059d7

commit_message:
Add yoga stable branch jobs on master gate

We have stable/yoga released now so we should add their
job on master gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to those branch.

This also removes the stable/ussuri job as it is in EM
state now.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I1297877db64364436d5160720bf33962024964e4

commit_message:
Ensure heat_stack_owner role exists before assigning it

The heat_stack_owner role is optional. However currently setting up
resources fails if heat is enabled but the role does not exist.

Change-Id: I6185cc8c6a63bd02b2bfcd4fe9e9c3e0fd1876d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/40/831640/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - block: - name: Ensure heat_stack_owner role exists openstack.cloud.identity_role: cloud: "{{ tempest_cloud_name }}" interface: "{{ tempest_interface_name }}" validate_certs: "{{ not (tempest_keystone_interface_insecure | bool) }}" name: heat_stack_owner register: add_heat_role until: add_heat_role is success retries: 5 delay: 10 - name: Add tempest users to heat_stack_owner role openstack.cloud.role_assignment: cloud: "{{ tempest_cloud_name }}" state: present user: "{{ item.name }}" role: "heat_stack_owner" project: "{{ item.project | default(item.name) }}" interface: "{{ tempest_interface_name }}" verify: "{{ not (tempest_keystone_interface_insecure | bool) }}" register: add_user_role until: add_user_role is success retries: 5 delay: 10 with_items: "{{ tempest_users }}"
deleted_lines: - name: Add tempest users to heat_stack_owner role openstack.cloud.role_assignment: cloud: "{{ tempest_cloud_name }}" state: present user: "{{ item.name }}" role: "heat_stack_owner" project: "{{ item.project | default(item.name) }}" interface: "{{ tempest_interface_name }}" verify: "{{ not (tempest_keystone_interface_insecure | bool) }}" register: add_user_role until: add_user_role is success retries: 5 delay: 10 with_items: "{{ tempest_users }}"

commit_message:
[stable/wallaby only] Update prometheus and grafana registries

This patch updates prometheus and grafana registries since quay.ceph.io
is down.

Change-Id: I261806b5344e805f4221d86edd4b1a6e113c95ac

commit_message:
Yoga-only: Show warning message for the deprecated tenant parameter

This is follow-up of 7eeb46e04d61189925dbbaa06d3016a0235d6200 and
ensures the warning message is shown when the deprecated tenant
parameter is used. The release note explains the deprecation but
explicit warning message would be helpful for users/operators.

This is directly submitted to stable/yoga because the parameter is
being removed in master.

Change-Id: Ic7cc1073dfdde7fd706bb2673dd82454f3a9378a

deleted_lines: $tenant = 'services',

Change-Id: Iadb757adfd1d1bd4e5bca08662e2b9db1e96e319

commit_message:
Check for requirements file to verify repo health

Currently we check for presence of sync file to confirm that repo
sync is healthy. Since sync file is not needed anymore
we should check for smth else. Requirements file should be
a good thing to check on since it's persistant and has expected naming.

Change-Id: Iadb757adfd1d1bd4e5bca08662e2b9db1e96e319

deleted_lines: repo_requirements_file: "repo_sync_complete"

commit_message:
Add guideline for Permission denied (publickey)

Add more guideline for Permission denied (publickey) status.

Change-Id: I3dccf05fa2f9f23d52bb0dd46e27f83877986b24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/77/841577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If you still got `Permission denied (publickey)` message, you might need to check if you hit `no mutual signature algorithm`. Any given system running OpenSSH 8.8 or newer as this release disables RSA signatures using the SHA-1 hash algorithm by default. Try to run following command: .. code-block:: console ssh -vv -p 29418 {username}@review.opendev.org If you saw `no mutual signature algorithm`, you need to consider use other algorithm instead of RSA. For example, use `ed25519` to generate your key and upload `id_ed25519.pub`. .. code-block:: console ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

commit_message:
Drop python3.6/3.7 support in testing runtime

In Zed cycle testing runtime, we are targetting to drop the
python 3.6/3.7 support, project started adding python 3.8 as minimum,

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Ia04aa9196689c52aff870d3a60fb74fdad81bb26

deleted_lines: python_requires = >=3.6 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.6 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.7

commit_message:
Use allow_access helper method

This helper method creates an access rule, waiting for it
to be active and delete it at the end of the test.
By using this methos we can reduce lines of code.

Change-Id: If1712cd412d236901232f9a2537f88d775f7d9f1

subject: wip: Stop nova-compute to avoid access to libvirt socket
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-25 04:27:20.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/migration/libvirt.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/da191bf9eec381b39f2a7119850492cbb88fdcd4', 'message': 'wip: Stop nova-compute to avoid access to libvirt socket

Change-Id: I5e00ef09024a1d5404313685b1fa59f2334cf0fd
'}]
commit_message:
wip: Stop nova-compute to avoid access to libvirt socket

Change-Id: I5e00ef09024a1d5404313685b1fa59f2334cf0fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/48/839148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $::osfamily == 'Debian' { # Make sure the nova-compute service is stopped. Otherwise it would # access libvirt socket which launches the libvirtd service exec { 'stop nova-compute.service': path => ['/sbin', '/usr/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin'], command => "systemctl -q stop ${nova::params::compute_service_name}.service", unless => "systemctl -q is-active libvirtd-${transport_real}.socket", require => Anchor['nova::install::end'], before => Exec['stop libvirtd.service'], } # In Ubuntu/Debian, libvirtd.service is enabled by default. However # the service should be stopped before socket service is started. # Otherwise, socket service fails to start. exec { 'stop libvirtd.service': path => ['/sbin', '/usr/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin'], command => 'systemctl -q stop libvirtd.service', unless => "systemctl -q is-active libvirtd-${transport_real}.socket", require => Anchor['nova::install::end'] } Exec['stop libvirtd.service'] -> Service["libvirtd-${transport_real}"] -> Service<| title == 'libvirt' |>
deleted_lines: # libvirtd.service should be stopped before socket service is started. # Otherwise, socket service fails to start. exec { 'stop libvirtd.service': path => ['/sbin', '/usr/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin'], command => 'systemctl -q stop libvirtd.service', unless => "systemctl -q is-active libvirtd-${transport_real}.socket", require => Anchor['nova::install::end'] Exec['stop libvirtd.service'] -> Service["libvirtd-${transport_real}"] -> Service<| title == 'libvirt' |>

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: Use ceph-common instead of ceph

The ceph package no longer requires python packages like python-ceph,
which are required by nova to use Ceph.

This change replaces the package by the ceph-common package which
require both the ceph package and the related ceph packages.

Change-Id: Ic3fda73730ac6b036082a3fd8aae531093bbcf9e
Closes-Bug: #1958092
(cherry picked from commit 228e3aa77bce532c63c83f14625a4fc606508336)
(cherry picked from commit 2f409b6d8873625dc0fcaa4916f2d99dceba59e5)
(cherry picked from commit 87171b3f9bc86722aea1157986c91548a5c5c746)

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle teting runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Add release notes, move py36 jobs to py38|9,
and update the python classifier for the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: Ibeee0b16ee1ea95f05127563a9cb08ffd0f04e2b

commit_message:
Handle OVS 2.17 change to Idl.tables

The update_tables() method needs to be updated to handle the new
IdlTable structure. Ultimately, we should move the update_tables
functionality into python_ovs. Until then, this should work with
both old and new versions of OVS.

Closes-Bug: #1972989
Co-authored-by: Rodolfo Alonso <ralonsoh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I173032f7cc63f79ee72ac7263188253e1cb6ff76
(cherry picked from commit 2e10d78ba356fec5187eac07a51d41e6fcc0a29d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp refs/changes/71/841471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: _tables = idl.IdlTable.schema_tables(self, schema) except AttributeError: _tables = None self.tables[table.name] = _tables[table.name] if _tables else table
deleted_lines: self.tables[table.name] = table

subject: [stable-only][CI] Install dependencies for docs target
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-28 16:48:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/48227374083c80c3fe9fd1c719d0e63f864151d3', 'message': "[stable-only][CI] Install dependencies for docs target

When tox 'docs' target is called, first it installs the dependencies
(listed in 'deps') in 'installdeps' phase, then it installs manila
(with its requirements) in 'develop-inst' phase. In the latter case
'deps' is not used so that the constraints defined in 'deps' are not
used. This could lead to failures on stable branches when new packages
are released that break the build. To avoid this, the simplest solution
is to pre-install requirements, i.e. add requirements.txt to 'docs' tox
target.

Change-Id: I8091b520c17f6e1af49c2342760290080776a111
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-04-28 18:01:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8f87bfb8d888895fc5fa54fdccd30a4a6f8478d9', 'message': "[stable-only][CI] Install dependencies for docs target

(with its requirements) in 'develop-inst' phase. In the latter case
'deps' is not used so that the constraints defined in 'deps' are not

are released that break the build. To avoid this, the simplest solution

Change-Id: I8091b520c17f6e1af49c2342760290080776a111

commit_message:
[stable-only][CI] Install dependencies for docs target

When tox 'docs' target is called, first it installs the dependencies
(listed in 'deps') in 'installdeps' phase, then it installs ironic
(with its requirements) in 'develop-inst' phase. In the latter case
'deps' is not used so that the constraints defined in 'deps' are not
used. This could lead to failures on stable branches when new packages
are released that break the build. To avoid this, the simplest solution
is to pre-install requirements, i.e. add requirements.txt to 'docs' tox
target.

Change-Id: I8091b520c17f6e1af49c2342760290080776a111
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/94/839794/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(elod.illes): requirements.txt is needed because otherwise # dependencies are installed during 'develop-inst' tox phase without # constraints which could cause failures in stable branches. -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt

commit_message:
Use /run/nginx.pid

In modern systems /var/run folder is just a symlink to
/run with potential to be removed in the future.

Currently, nginx might fail on Debian jobs because of that [1]

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/54263ee3816c484d94505a629558218c/log/logs/openstack/aio1_repo_container-da3488c9/nginx.service.journal-12-02-06.log.txt

Change-Id: I19321a61cce978e781c3581fcc136609b5be8092
(cherry picked from commit 4f3bec16800c03352c89824561cf4daedd0ce0af)

commit_message:
Handle OVS 2.17 change to Idl.tables

The update_tables() method needs to be updated to handle the new
IdlTable structure. Ultimately, we should move the update_tables
functionality into python_ovs. Until then, this should work with
both old and new versions of OVS.

Closes-Bug: #1972989
Co-authored-by: Rodolfo Alonso <ralonsoh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I173032f7cc63f79ee72ac7263188253e1cb6ff76
(cherry picked from commit 2e10d78ba356fec5187eac07a51d41e6fcc0a29d)

commit_message:
Prevent temporary volume from being deleted accidentally

A temporary volume can be deleted while it is in use by DELETE API
accidentally because its status is `available`. To avoid this deletion,
this fix sets a value which doesn't accept deletion to volume status of
a temporary volume. When a temporary volume is used for backing up,
`backing-up` is set. When a temporary volume is used for reverting a
snapshot, `in-use` is set because the volume is attached by a host.

Closes-Bug: #1970768
Change-Id: Ib6a2e4d68e532b91161df5245c17ce815f12f935
(cherry picked from commit 53c13891b313d58923b223f6fbb1882e991f2785)
(cherry picked from commit d773fae8256f76ee78c81a5c07096a45227c6569)

commit_message:
Handle OVS 2.17 change to Idl.tables

The update_tables() method needs to be updated to handle the new
IdlTable structure. Ultimately, we should move the update_tables
functionality into python_ovs. Until then, this should work with
both old and new versions of OVS.

Closes-Bug: #1972989
Co-authored-by: Rodolfo Alonso <ralonsoh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I173032f7cc63f79ee72ac7263188253e1cb6ff76
(cherry picked from commit 2e10d78ba356fec5187eac07a51d41e6fcc0a29d)

Add flag to conditionally create certificate authorities.

A list of potential CA can be passed in, but external conditionals
decide which are created.

(cherry picked from commit 96eae957b06e84dce45159faf1008de9a69a26e0)

commit_message:
[OVN] Allow schema checks to happen before starting connection

get_schema_helper() makes a direct short-lived connection to the
ovsb-server to grab the running schema before we initiate a
connection for the Idl. Moving the schema retrieving code out of
the path of starting the connection allows us to adjust to the
ovsdb-server's schema version at driver init instead of having to
set it in post_fork_initialize().

One benefit of this is that Events can be more easily defined to
watch for a table which might change depending on the schema, e.g.
Chassis vs Chassis_Private.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8 [1] when backported
to Victoria is modified to use schema name instead of schema helper
when from_server is called as schema helper functions are not
supported. With this patch, schema helper is supported and so
_set_inactivity_probe() is modified to use schema helper.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8

Change-Id: Ia3dd792f4335fcde0df7d11e6aaf693dd9611bb6
(cherry picked from commit 96eae957b06e84dce45159faf1008de9a69a26e0)

commit_message:
fix helm-release-status role to use helm3 commands

Helm3 requires specifying a namespace to retrieve status and values for
a given release.

Before this role would not retrieve any values or statuses. Now values
and statuses are retrieved in saved in Zuul archive correctly.

Change-Id: If8cf28349b0c14ba6e1de74d49e46ab4a61b93c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/61/840761/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for namespace in $(kubectl get namespaces --no-headers --output custom-columns=":metadata.name"); do mkdir {{ logs_dir }}/helm/releases/$namespace mkdir {{ logs_dir }}/helm/values/$namespace for release in $(helm list --short --namespace $namespace); do helm status $release --namespace $namespace >> {{ logs_dir }}/helm/releases/$namespace/$release.txt helm get values $release --namespace $namespace --all >> {{ logs_dir }}/helm/values/$namespace/$release.yaml done done
deleted_lines: - name: "retrieve all deployed charts" shell: |- set -e helm ls --short args: executable: /bin/bash register: helm_releases ignore_errors: True helm status {{ helm_released }} >> {{ logs_dir }}/helm/releases/{{ helm_release }}.txt helm get values {{ helm_released }} >> {{ logs_dir }}/helm/values/{{ helm_release }}.yaml vars: helm_release: "{{ helm_released }}" loop_control: loop_var: helm_released with_items: "{{ helm_releases.stdout_lines }}"

commit_message:
Add victoria/wallaby/xena stable branch jobs on master gate

We have stable/victoria, stable/wallaby, and
stable/xena released so we should add their job on
master gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to those branch.

This also removes the stable/train|stein|rocky job as they
are in EM state now.

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I1ae7cf05a7e73f2f05eaaa27cd3613beb0c455a9

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: Use ceph-common instead of ceph

The ceph package no longer requires python packages like python-ceph,
which are required by nova to use Ceph.

This change replaces the package by the ceph-common package which
require both the ceph package and the related ceph packages.

Change-Id: Ic3fda73730ac6b036082a3fd8aae531093bbcf9e
Closes-Bug: #1958092
(cherry picked from commit 228e3aa77bce532c63c83f14625a4fc606508336)
(cherry picked from commit 2f409b6d8873625dc0fcaa4916f2d99dceba59e5)

commit_message:
Fix BIND9 log collection

Currently the bind logs are not viewable in the zuul logs page, they prompt
for download. The wrong systemd unit logs are being exported and they were being double gziped. This patch corrects both of those issues such that the BIND9 logs will be properly collected in the zuul jobs.

Change-Id: Ied091e7acd0cb2c837f8ee7335b7881225da0126

commit_message:
Repair Gaps: Add a probe test

This patch adds a probe test. It places makes 2 gaps in 5 shard ranges:
  Active, Shrinking, Active, Shrinking

The shrinking ranges are considered gaps and the 2 active don't cover
them. The probe test the uses the s-m-s-r to repair. The 3rd range ends
up being the acceptor for both the Shrinking because of the gap on the
end mean it needs to use the preceeding range as an acceptor.
It then runs the sharders and the gaps shrink away!

Feel free to squash it down and change it how you like :)

Change-Id: I8cf5076da5b0b304c83e4d373f50dc3870fe4501

added_lines: def test_manage_shard_ranges_repair_root_shrinking_gaps(self): # provoke shrinking gaps in root container and repair obj_names = self._make_object_names(16) self.put_objects(obj_names) client.post_container(self.url, self.admin_token, self.container_name, headers={'X-Container-Sharding': 'on'}) # run replicators first time to get sync points set self.replicators.once() # find 4 shard ranges on nodes[0] self.assert_subprocess_success([ 'swift-manage-shard-ranges', self.get_db_file(self.brain.part, self.brain.nodes[0]), 'find_and_replace', '4', '--enable']) shard_ranges_0 = self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[0], 'unsharded', 4) # Run sharder to get them all sharded self.sharders_once(additional_args='--partitions=%s' % self.brain.part) self.sharders_once(additional_args='--partitions=%s' % self.brain.part) self.sharders_once(additional_args='--partitions=%s' % self.brain.part) self.replicators.once() # Make sure they're sharding self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[0], 'sharded', 4) self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[1], 'sharded', 4) # now we want to go in and make the 2nd and the last shard as # SHRINKING but they wont have an acceptor. So these will be detected # as a gap. We pick the last one as it's acceptor will become the # preceeding range. broker = self.get_broker(self.brain.part, self.brain.nodes[0], self.account, self.container_name) shard_ranges = broker.get_shard_ranges() for index in (1, 3): timestamp = Timestamp.now() shard_ranges[index].update_state(ShardRange.SHRINKING, timestamp) shard_ranges[index].epoch = timestamp broker.merge_shard_ranges(shard_ranges) # Copy the changes out. self.replicators.once() shard_ranges = self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[0], 'sharded', 4) self.assertEqual([ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRINKING, ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRINKING], [sr.state for sr in shard_ranges]) shard_ranges = self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[1], 'sharded', 4) self.assertEqual([ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRINKING, ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRINKING], [sr.state for sr in shard_ranges]) # Get the db file so we can run s-m-s-r db_file = self.get_db_file(self.brain.part, self.brain.nodes[0]) self.assert_subprocess_success( ['swift-manage-shard-ranges', db_file, 'repair', '--gaps', '--yes']) shard_ranges = self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[0], 'sharded', 4) # should be the same except 3rd range should now be an acceptor # for both gaps. self.assertEqual([ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRINKING, ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRINKING], [sr.state for sr in shard_ranges]) acceptor = shard_ranges[2] self.assertEqual(acceptor.lower, shard_ranges[1].lower) self.assertEqual(acceptor.upper, shard_ranges[3].upper) # replicate it out and then run the sharder on the shrinking shards # and they will shrink into the acceptor. self.replicators.once() self.sharders_once() self.sharders_once() shard_ranges = self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[0], 'sharded', 2) broker = self.get_broker(self.brain.part, self.brain.nodes[0], self.account, self.container_name) shard_ranges = broker.get_shard_ranges(include_deleted=True) self.assertEqual([ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRUNK, ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.SHRUNK], [sr.state for sr in shard_ranges]) self.assertTrue(shard_ranges[1].deleted) self.assertTrue(shard_ranges[3].deleted) shard_ranges = self.assert_container_state(self.brain.nodes[1], 'sharded', 2) self.assertEqual([ShardRange.ACTIVE, ShardRange.ACTIVE], [sr.state for sr in shard_ranges]) self.assert_container_listing(obj_names)

commit_message:
Adding a test to cover: "Show the status of a service" API

1) New test case: "test_admin_show_service_status"
   Show service status and make sure that all expected
   fields present in response
2) Re-factoring: moving negative test scenario to the
   dedicated class.

Change-Id: I09cde6142e2d76f6d5bc08202837d9de76687036

commit_message:
Revert "Fix race with DPDK and vhostuserclient mode"

This reverts commit 21b076e7dfb8a28eb520769f0b257e761f863597.

Reason for revert: During the Zed PTG it was decided that to solve
the race condition between os-vif and Neutron when deleting trunk
bridges, os-vif will be responsible of both the creation and the
deletion of the bridge (see Day 2 first topic at [1]). As a
consequence, the change in this patch is not needed anymore

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-April/028164.html

Change-Id: I7b9eff3e7154c2e2502c6c686f2edb2bdcb78c1e

commit_message:
Zone Export - some refactoring and new test case to scenario test suite

1) test_all_recordset_types_exist_in_show_zonefile
   Verifies: "All zone's recordsets (vary of types
	      and number of records) presents in
	      the zonefile export"
2) Refactoring the existing tests by adding "wait_until"
   that wasn't in use.

Change-Id: I6b657ef83f04a84526ca7ba29a5b7d0d756402f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/90/835990/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json import os cls.recordset_client = cls.os_primary.dns_v2.RecordsetClient() @decorators.idempotent_id('d8f444aa-a645-4a03-b366-46836f57dc69') def test_all_recordset_types_exist_in_show_zonefile(self): LOG.info('create a zone') zone = self.zones_client.create_zone()[1] self.addCleanup(self.wait_zone_delete, self.zones_client, zone['id']) json_path = os.path.join( os.path.dirname(__file__), 'recordset_wildcard_data.json').replace('scenario', 'api') isFileExits = os.path.exists(json_path) if not isFileExits: raise self.skipException( "Could not find 'recordset_wildcard_data.json'") file = open(json_path, "r") load_file = json.loads(file.read()) count_records = 0 for record_type, record_data in load_file.items(): if record_data['name'] is not None: record_name = record_data['name'] + "." + zone['name'] count_records += len(record_data['records']) else: record_name = zone['name'] recordset_data = { 'name': record_name, 'type': record_data['type'], 'records': record_data['records'], } LOG.info('Create a Recordset') recordset = self.recordset_client.create_recordset( zone['id'], recordset_data)[1] self.addCleanup(self.wait_recordset_delete, self.recordset_client, zone['id'], recordset['id']) LOG.info('Create a zone export') zone_export = self.client.create_zone_export(zone['id'])[1] self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_zone_export, zone_export['id']) LOG.info('Wait until the zone export is complete') waiters.wait_for_zone_export_status( self.client, zone_export['id'], const.COMPLETE) LOG.info('Show exported zonefile') show_file = self.client.show_exported_zonefile(zone_export['id'])[1] self.assertEqual(zone['name'], show_file.origin) self.assertEqual(zone['ttl'], show_file.ttl) self.assertEqual( len(show_file.records), count_records, "The Recordsets count from JSON file don't match" "to the recordset are displayed in an exported zone file") file.close()

commit_message:
Add example dashboard config file

This change introduces an example dashboard config file so that users
can more easily set up the recommended parameters and understand
the available parameters. Horizon supports loading multiple config
files from local_settings.d and it is now encouraged to implement
per-dashboard config file.

Change-Id: I423d4811ead2c0c8f79fc0d80f3c7fe8d3578c97

commit_message:
Changes in "test_quotas.py" API script

1) Re-factoring:
   1. Replacing underscores by indexes
   2. Moving all negative tests into the dedicated class
   3. Using all_projects_header
2) Changing "test_show_quotas" test logic.
   The existing test is based and depends on "quotas update" API
   and it has almost the same logic as:"test_update_quotas".
   New scenario is about to validate that all expected quota types
   are listed in "Show API" response and that their values are integers.
   Note: test uses both: admin and primary users to cover both "show" APIs:
   https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/dns/?expanded=get-the-name-servers-
   for-a-zone-detail#view-quotas
   https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/dns/?expanded=get-the-name-servers-
   for-a-zone-detail#view-current-project-s-quotas
3) "test_admin_sets_not_existing_quota_type" - try to set quotas using
    not existing quota type in its body, expected: quota_resource_unknown

Change-Id: I9b3d6ee5fc27011b8852739f0ca3ab33fd04d58e

commit_message:
Remove reference to the removed parameter

The records_use_fips parameter was removed when v1 API support was
removed[1]. This change removes remaining reference to the parameter
in README.

[1] fe68f0f1bc33ba99ea5612b4bf5877007bf7a5f7

Change-Id: Ica3cf7eba8a1e4ef87a832191b88fafd0afe02d4

commit_message:
Rename "Floating IP Description" field

Currently, UI uses "Floating IP Description" term both for
Project-Networks and DNS-Reverse DNS dashboards, which present different
entities. This situation is confusing, so proposed patch clarifies which
exactly description is shown

Closes-Bug: #1947328
Change-Id: Idf243f74362220bb8d518a7230ef67d4e16da192
